Summary: We found the hotel, staff and amenities to be excellent and provide a good base to explore the wonderful town of Laguna beach.  Small touches like the cookies, wine hour and local knowledge all helped our stay be such a relaxing one.

LBH was a great find via an Instagram post. Great location just up the hill from Main Beach making Laguna walkable. Peter was very helpful with restaurant recommendations- carmelitas is a must!!! We loved the wine hour 5-6 followed by cookies and milk for the kids. All great before heading out. The fire pit with chill out music in the evening was lovely- we even cooked s’mores on it. The pool is small but the kids enjoyed it. I’d actually give it 4.5/5 due to the lack of bar and the fact we weren’t informed that we could use the facilities at their sister hotel which would have been nice. Would recommend for 2 or 3 nights.

We loved this place and wish we had stayed for longer. The kids loved the pool, although it wad small. We were also able to use the facilities at their sister hotel the inn at laguna which was close to main beach. Michelle at the front desk was so friendly and helpful; wine hour and cookie time were both great touches. Loved the small personal feel of the hotel and the west coast surf theme of the lobby and rooms. Would not hesitate to recommend this place and stay here again.

We stayed 3 nights and had a wonderful time.  The location is great as we were able to walk most places.  The hotel is so well decorated! They think of everything from beach towels and chairs to use at the beach, accessories in the room, non allergic pillows and we all loved the wine and cookies in the evening  and coffee and Greek yogurt in the mornings.  Would definitely recommend!

We headed out of LA to beat the heat for a quick over night stay on our way to La Jolla and we were so glad we stayed here. The hotel was easy to find and check-in was a breeze. The staff was friendly and gave us the low down of the area. We made it to our nice sized room and all 3 of us immediately took a nap. At about 6pm we took the pup for a walk along the coast and beach just a block away. When we came back we took advantage of their nightly wine and then milk and cookies before relaxing the rest of the evening. We want to come back but for longer next time. The TripAdvisor deal for the hotel was pretty good also. Parking and WiFi were included.

When you check in to Laguna Beach House you receive a warm welcome. The property has everything you need—views, pools, convenience to the beaches and to downtown Laguna. Truly perfect all around hotel that hasn’t lost the ability to keep customers comfortable and happy. It’s clean, chic, casual.

We found the room to be clean and relatively large. We spent a wonderful couple of days biking down to Ventura and back. The small breakfast was well stocked and more than adequate to avoid paying for a cafe style breakfast.  The hotel was situated class to the beach but also within easy walking distance to State street.

Rooms are clean and spacious. Property is well located, walkable to the beach and the center of town.  They do charge for parking and wifi, so be advised. Staff is knowledgeable and courteous.  A very simple breakfast of granola and yogurt is provided, but substantial breakfast is available nearby.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel in a great location! The staff was incredible and always so helpful. Wonderful!
Summary: Simple and charming. All that we needed for a week at the beach! Cookies and milk for the littles and wine for the adults. Walking distance to everything or just catch the free trolley. Staff was amazing, rooms very clean and the pool area was awesome. Nothing fancy just perfectly California. Oh and the beach supplies were amazing!

Having stayed here for a night I wish I was staying for more. The hotel is amazing and I can't find any faults. The decor is beach and surfing theme and the rooms are spacious and so comfy. This hotel has everything you need and I really enjoyed my night here.  Laguna itself is a great place to stay. Very upbeat with lots of bars, resturants and beaches.  Laguna is definitely on my list of places to go back too!!

Summary Heading: Relaxing in an adorable hotel in a great location
Summary: What a great find! This was a great boutique hotel in a fantastic location in Laguna! It was a reasonable and enjoyable walk to downtown Laguna. The beach is very close and the hotel provides chairs, towels, and umbrellas for the day. They offer wine, then cookies in the late afternoon, which is just a nice touch. Visit Urth for coffee or breakfast just down the block in the mornings and it will make your trip!
Manager Response: Hi Susan R, What a wonderful review...thank you so much! It is so nice to get that feedback from our guests. I'm glad you enjoyed the wine and cookies in the evening; the guests seem to really enjoy that at the end of a relaxing beach day. We hope you'll decide to come back and join us again. Have a great day! -Steven

Summary: We enjoyed our overnight visit to Laguna Beach and our stay at Laguna Beach House. Our room was nicely furnished, had a small balcony and a view of the ocean. It is walking distance from the town area which was great. Good to have on-site parking also.

Adorable property with friendly staff. I loved the decor and little touches like yogurt and granola in the am, wine in the evening and freshly baked bedtime cookies. Pool is nice but tiny - but more than sufficient for my quick visit with two young kids. Plus there is a hot tub and great fire pit. Town is an easy walk. It was just the perfect easy hotel - no long waits at a valet (self park) or to check in, no fighting for a spot at the pool. Cant wait to return.
Manager Response: Hi callie827, I'm so glad you and the kids enjoyed your "overnight getaway." You mentioned our amenities; I really enjoy them too! The simple combination of the hotel decor as well as our friendly staff absolutely makes our place a hidden gem. Thanks for the kind review! You're welcome back anytime:) Enjoy the day and we'll see you again soon! -Steven

Summary Heading: Small hotel/motel in a convenient location
Summary: We typically stay at 4 star hotels but decided to try the Laguna Beach House. The room was cozy, comfortable, clean and had a nice beach decour. The carpet could have been a bit cleaner but I assume that was normal considering beach goers. Our room was right next to the elevator but we could not hear it. The room was pretty quite all together, considering it was right off of the PCH. it is kind of on the edge of downtown Laguna Beach which is good and bad as the traffic in downtown was heavy but I would recommend you drive and park there versus walk which is fine. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. The parking area is easy to get in and out of. We liked it and would defintly stay there again and would recommend it to others. Nice view of the Pacific.

Hotel was clean and comfortable in a great location. Staff was very friendly. Price seemed a bit high for not being directly on the beach and not having breakfast or restaurant on site. Otherwise, we greatly enjoyed our stay!

I was over in LA for business so I decided to extend the stay and spend another week with my partner on the Pacific Coast. She had never been to the US so Laguna is a pretty sweet intro 😃 The hotel is easy to find on the main PCH and the parking is great (but expensive for us Brits, as it’s normally part of the room rate). The rooms are great and as a fan of surfing we loved all the beach touches. The availability of towels and beach stuff like chairs was awesome and we made use of them everyday. The only downside would be each room needs a hairdryer. We had some amazing meals in the local area and we can highly recommend - Mozambique for the roof top views and sunsets,  Neapolitan for pizza up on the pch towards Dana Point, Eva’s Caribbean Kitchen, 230 Forest Avenue for fine

Summary Heading: A Small Friendly Hotel With a Great Location
Summary: My wife and I just returned from a three-day stay at this charming hotel. Parking can be problematic during the high tourist season in Laguna Beach but not to worry here because the hotel provides ample parking, much of it covered. The hotel is located just a block or so from a free trolley which will easily get you to the main shopping and eating establishments further south of the hotel. The beach is a five minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is fresh from a recent remodel and the rooms are small but well appointed. The staff was more than friendly and provided excellent information regarding things to do, places to eat, etc. We would gladly return should we find ourselves in Laguna Beach again.
Manager Response: Hi DLGo, Wow! Thank you for the wonderful review! I'm so glad to hear that you & your wife had a great time here! It is so great to get that feedback from our guests...such a huge compliment! Our staff really is helpful and friendly and we enjoy giving tips as faer as what beach to visit or where to eat. Thanks again and of course you two are welcome back here anytime.  -Steven

Summary: This small (36 rooms) has been recently renovated with a beachy theme. There in an attached hotel garage ($15 a day which is a bargain) and the front staff was super friendly and helpful. Complementary wine hour at 5:00 and milk and cookies available after that. And it's a short block to the ocean walk.
Manager Response: Hi Marsha W, Your review was so nice! Thank you! We did recently renovate our hotel and they did a wonderful job w/the décor and subtle beachy items in every room. I'm glad you enjoyed the friendly staff too. Everyone here is such a joy to work with. please come see us again and have a great day! -Steven

Summary: The hotel has recently be renovated and it shows.  The rooms are bright beachy theme wonderful comfortable bedding I love the huggy pillow. Salt water pool was just what the doctor ordered.  The staff is very attentive, courteous, and go the xtra mile to make your stay comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel.  The wine time is a nice way to meet fellow travelers and maybe new friends I just wish they would have chardonnay bummer

What a gorgeous little hotel, right by the beach and city centre in Laguna! Staff were SO friendly and helpful, rooms were stunning - light, spacious, immaculately designed, and with THE MOST comfortable beds. It has a nice size pool, a hot tub and a fire pit that is switched on in the evenings - oh, and the whole pool area is lit up by beautiful fairy lights. It was just so beautiful and my husband and I had the loveliest time here. Miss it already and will for sure be back one day!
Manager Response: Hi Annette H, Thank you so much for your amazing review of our property and staff. We appreciate it very much! When the property was totally renovated over 3 years ago, it really transformed our little hotel in to something special and unique. And our staff is truly incredible as well! I just can't say enough good things about them. I'm glad you felt the same when you and your husband were here. We hope to see you both again soon! Have a great day!  -Steven

Summary: Crisp interior and very clean. Total cottage feel with white on white interior and some colorful touches. How nice to have coffee in the morning, California oranges mid day, wine at 5 and cookies before bed.  Cute beach toys and blankets for sale but beach chairs, umbrella and towels for free.  Cute but too” kiddy “pool for us older folks.  Lovely and accommodating staff. We loved the walkable location both to town and beach. We will be back.  Request a second floor room with a view.
Manager Response: Hi Linda L, Thanks for the wonderful review and recognizing our amazing staff! I also love our amenities here from coffee & Greek yogurt w/granola in the morning to wine & fresh cookies @ night. It's so great to hear feedback from the guests. We appreciate it! we'll see you next time.  -Steven

Summary: My favorite place to stay in Laguna Beach . I love the location . The hotel is beautiful beach feel . Great front desk personal service , thank you Peter !! I have been coming here for the last 3 years ! Can’t wait to return !!!
Manager Response: Hi Phi J, Thank you so much for the awesome review! I also love the beach feel of the hotel! I'm especially proud of our incredible staff, Peter being one of our best. We're lucky to have him! Thank you for being a loyal guest of ours. I hope it continues and we'll see you soon. -Steven

Summary: Prime location for site seeing, shopping, walking and watching the 4th of July fireworks at Laguna Beach.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We enjoyed our stay and will be back in the future.
Manager Response: Hi Andre B, We are so glad you enjoyed your stay! The Beach House really is the prime location when watching the fireworks on 4th of July. It's incredible how close we are to "the action." I'm so glad the staff was friendly and accommodating as well. It's so nice to receive such positive feedback from the guests. Thank you! -Steven

Summary: Already reviewed 3 times, not showing? I wouldn't stay anywhere else, nor will my family! Beautiful rooms, most friendly staff I've ever had the pleasure to deal with!! Says its 3 star, I give it 5! In center of pretty much everything!
Manager Response: Hi antsa2018, Thank you for writing such a great review! We are so happy you like it here! Our staff definitely makes this hotel a special place to visit. Please feel free to introduce yourself next time you visit us...hope to see you and your family again very soon. -Steven

Summary Heading: Nice little hotel near Heisler Park
Summary: Nice hotel, right around the corner from Heisler Park and great beach spots.  Cookies in the evening are a nice touch.  Small breakfast offering is just perfect to get your day started.  They also offer a happy hour with wine in the evening.  Has a small family feel to it.
Manager Response: Hi Jbka6863, I'm so glad you enjoyed the hotel! Our position along PCH does allow for easy access to our local beaches and great restaurants too. The "small family feel" you mentioned is so nice to hear. Since we're a smaller hotel (36 rooms), we get the opportunity to take time with our guests and really get to know them while they're here. Have a great day and thanks for the kind review. -Steven

Summary Heading: Close to the beach and wonderful!
Summary: This hotel is about a 10-minute walk to the beach.  Views from the room were gorgeous.  The hotel itself was clean and inviting.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Walking distance to a couple really good restaurants.

Great employees, shout out for Pete who cares about customers and the hotel  Superb location  Nicely remodelled rooms, surf funky Good bed  Aircon was awful though - sounded like a truck coming through the wall! Beware additional charges for parking and daily rate for what they see extras

Summary Heading: Room was okay, service was uneven
Summary: Given the amount we paid, I found the room to be okay (the walls were really thin, which I haven't experienced in a while at a hotel of this price).  But the larger issue was that the service was uneven.  There was a very amped up demeanor to several of the front desk workers that was not welcoming and added needless stress to what should've been a sleepy getaway.  They were sharp or blunt in almost every interaction.  It made us feel less than welcomed.  Lots of potential but didn't live up to the price at all.

I am a corporate client, and really enjoy the hotel, just a couple issues that i think are becoming a issue.  1. i think the carpeting in the rooms has caused a odor that can't be hidden with deodorizer. i think the new modern sheet vinyl that looks like wood could be a large improvement 2. the Television this last week, had no sound on the Fox News channel.  3. the staff as always is superior, and greatly appreciated

Wonderful location for the beach and downtown shops! Rooms were tastefully decorated in bright California beach decor. Bed was super comfortable and our corner room offered great views of the beach and ocean!  The yogurt/ granola breakfast and evening cookies were a great plus. Great service and easy parking.  Nice way to explore Laguna Beach!!
Manager Response: Hi Jeffrey O, Thank you for writing such a great review! I also enjoy the California beach décor. It's really nice to hear such positive feedback from our guests. Thank you! There are so many hidden gems here in Laguna and I think our hotel is one of 'em. Have a great day and hopefully we'll see you again soon.  -Steven

Summary Heading: Great place but overpriced for what you get
Summary: We came here over the 4th of July to celebrate our anniversary. Although this is a cute hotel, it’s a little pricey for what you get. First of all, the view of the fireworks is phenomenal. We felt like we were immersed in the festivities, which was wonderful. The proximity to the park and the views of the ocean are a real plus. I loved the pool and the Jacuzzi.  But we were surprised to hear that there was an amenity fee of $15 which I thought was a little unusual. I think this included access to the pool, pool towels, and maybe the cookies, the wine and  granola and coffee in the morning. The cookies were gone when we came downstairs one evening. There are lots of families here so perhaps that was the reason.  But the location is a real plus, putting you near a few art
Manager Response: Hi Grathy, You are so nice to write such a great review. We all appreciate it very much!...but I'm sorry to hear that you felt that we were overpriced. I have to say that July 4th does tend to be the most expensive time of the year for all the hotels in general along the Laguna coastline. Hopefully you'll decide to come back and visit us another time. September and October are absolutely beautiful here and the cost is much less as well. Have a good day and thanks again for the review. -Steven

Summary: I needed a last minute room for one night and this place was perfect! The staff were very accommodating and loved the late check out at noon. The bed and pillows were comfy as well. I highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Hi DenFlan, Thank you for taking the time to write such a great review. We're always here if you need a quick get away! We are very proud of our staff. I'm glad they were so accommodating and we look forward to seeing you again. -Steven

Summary: We had a wonderful stay. Traveling with our twin 6 year olds can be trying at times, but the hotel was very accommodating. The night crew was very knowledgable about the area while the afternoon front desk could use some area knowledge. the decor was the draw for us. My husband is a fine art surf artist and we loved the memorabilia married with modern surf culture vibe. Though we weren't on the beach the location was close to everything. They provided towels, umbrellas and cute but not very comfortable beach chairs for our June Gloom game of Go Fish at the beach which was delightful! Daily cookies and milk were a special treat for the girls and the wine hit the spot for mommy! It was a prefect couple days of Ohana Vacation. Laguna is somewhat over priced for everything but the
Manager Response: Hi Oshingurl, Thank you for visiting us and writing such a great review. I'm glad you and your husband enjoyed the décor and the surf vibe too! I'm sorry it was gloomy while you were here but cookies and wine always seem to make things brighter:) Please visit us again. Have a good day! -Steven

Summary: California casual with a beachy vibe located walking distance from galleries, restaurants and the beach. Super friendly and helpful staff make you feel like you're staying with friends. Really enjoyed the poolside fire pit. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Enjoyed my stay.
Manager Response: Hi Debi, Thank you so much for the kind review. We're very lucky to have such an amazing staff. The overall "vibe" of the hotel is felt by the staff as well as the guests who visit us. I'm so glad you enjoyed yourself here and we hope to see you again very soon. Have a great day! -Steven

Summary Heading: Lovely location and great customer service
Summary: We stayed here with family for my sister in laws wedding and were impressed with the rooms and grounds. The employees were great, especially Jonathan! The only things we didn’t love was the plain yogurt/granola breakfast and the room above us was pretty loud at night, sounded like vacuuming or something. But everything else was great, it’s lovely.

Summary Heading: Expensive for a non beach front hotel!
Summary: We do love this property, but it has become too expensive for a non beach front location. The fees for parking and resort fee is a joke .  Pushed the room rate with taxes, etc up way up!  The wine in the evening and yogurt/coffee in the am are both marginal .  Pool and spa are lovely, grounds and room nice and clean .  Property very empty for Memorial Day week     yogurt

What a charming hotel. We arrived late in the evening and Peter could not have been nicer!.  The cookies and milk in the lobby were a perfect touch to the end of a long drive.  Our room made us feel like we were on vacation—spacious, surf boards on the wall, comfy bathrobes, and a charming sink-area tucked under the eave.  The pool and hot tub area could not have been more inviting, complete with a roaring fire pit, Adirondack chairs, and twinkling lights.  It was a perfect night to start our vacation.  Thank you to Annette who helped us the next morning with tourist suggestions (Pacific Marine Mammal Center is a definite must!). The lobby serves yogurt and granola in the morning, oranges and water in the day time, wine at happy hour, and cookies and milk at bedtime.  This hotel

Love this place! Lots of character, clean, friendly staff, very nice pool area and easy short walk to Heisler Park. Would definitely stay again if ever in Laguna beach. Bonus free oranges and water during the day, evening cookies and morning yogurt granola cups

Summary Heading: Fantastic Value. Superb accommodations and amenities!
Summary: We lived the Laguna Beach House and felt very lucky that we landed there unknowingly! Thank you to the staff for making us feel so welcome and special. We will definitely stay there again if we visit Laguna Beach!

Having stayed at the sister property (Inn at Laguna Beach) we had high hopes. We where not disappointed. Friendly staff and very nice accommodations. The main difference is the INN is right on the beach and slightly closer to town. Ample parking is available. Very comfortable bedding and excellent HVAC. Excellent cafe's nearby for breakfast including Urth Caffe and Las Brisas

We just spent our anniversary 3-night weekend here and loved it. Great location for walking to town and the beach. Very friendly and helpful staff. They provide chairs, towels and umbrellas for the beach. Will come again for sure.

Cant say enough about our overall experience from the location to all that this special area has to offer, the hospitality of the staff<kudos to Tray> , and the general vibe of this low keyed property.. Loved the firepit in the eve as the nights were cool and our daily am walks in the Park right out the door...Special place for those that don't require a lot of fuss..... The only complaint<albeit minor> are the fees incurred upon checkout.

The room was bright and clean , the location is great just a two min walk into town , the bed was comfortable, shower and toilet small , with a sink on the outside of the shower room , the view was disappointing, I had upgraded to an ocean view with balcony, the balcony was very tiny but was able to have two chairs and a small table , but when u sit down all you mostly see if the tops of other buildings around with a sliver of ocean view , not worth the price for ocean view

The Laguna Beach House is as cute in person as it is in the pictures. Everything is clean and new, and nicely decorated. The room with two queen beds is really roomy. The staff is really nice. There were fun little extras like nightly wine and evening milk & cookies. There was a nice coffee, tea and parfait spread each morning. The pool and hot tub area is great and includes a nice fire pit, too. I liked the smaller size of the hotel and the personalized feel of the place. I highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Hi jodis577,  We're so glad you enjoyed your visit. The smaller size of the hotel really does allow us to get to know the guests on a much more personal level. Thanks for writing such a wonderful review. The staff really appreciates it! We look forward to seeing you again soon. -Steven

Summary: Love the style, the feel, the room, the amenities, staff, and the view!!! Quick walk to the park and beach. Paradise! Special shout out to Dennis and Peter for  making my stay such a lovely one. Definitely returning.
Manager Response: Hi kerry751, Thank you for writing such a wonderful review. The feel of the hotel really is something special and our staff is amazing too. We're very lucky to have them. Heisler Park (across the street) is so serene and pristine. It's nice to have it so close to the hotel so our guests can enjoy it as well. The City of Laguna Beach takes great care of it all year round. We look forward to seeing you again! Summer is quickly approaching. -Steven

Summary: Nice location, friendly, helpful staff.  Lovely spot for drinks on the roof of their sister Hotel.  Close to a great park.  Very few rooms with views.  Puzzling that the coffee service in the room did not include sweeter or creamer.
Manager Response: Hi drckn, Thank you for taking the time to write this review. Our sister property, The Inn @ Laguna Beach does have a beautiful terrace that overlooks Main Beach. It's pretty hard to beat. We're glad you enjoyed the location and our friendly staff. I'm sorry to hear there wasn't sweetener or creamer in your room. We do have those items in the lobby along with coffee and tea and a Greek yogurt w/granola every morning from 6a-10a. I'd be happy to help next time you find yourself in Laguna Beach again. See you soon! -Steven

Summary: Awesome cottage feel with helpful and very friendly staff! Rooms are updated and extremely clean.  We loved the location.  Close to restaurants, beach, and park.  We didn’t need a car to enjoy all that Luguna Beach has to offer.

The Laguna Beach House exceeded expectations. The staff was friendly and responded very quickly. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and comfortable. The pool/fire pit are is very nice & a great location, close proximity to the beach and bars/restaurants.

This place was just right - we weren’t looking for frills and it was clean and simple with all the amenities we wanted. Staff was super friendly, rooms were nice. A reallly short walk to town or the beach, we’d definitely go back!

This was the perfect spot for a quick girls getaway.They offer light breakfast, happy hour, and cookies in the lobby; small pool, fireplace outside the rooms. Clean and nice. The only thing missing was an ocean view. But the ambience was charming enough. This is on my list to return.
Manager Response: Dear sleague,  I'm glad that you chose us for the quick girls getaway that you had. We do wish that we had a more upfront ocean view but I believe that the ambiance of the hotel and surrounding made up for it. Glad to hear that we are on your list to return as we will be right here waiting for you when you do come back!  Looking forward to welcoming you back!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: Can’t say enough about this stay. Hotel is amazing and staff are all class acts. Top knotch. One of the highlights of our trip. Enjoyed all the small attention to details in the decor. Wine? Milk and cookies? Can’t lose.
Manager Response: Dear DawnaB905,  Thank you for the kind words about our hotel and staff! We love our guests and always try to have fun with them and I appreciate that you appreciated it. Who wouldn't love Wine and Milk and Cookies, I know I do! We are looking forward for your return to Laguna Beach House. Hopefully we see you soon!  Best Regards,   Steven K.

Summary Heading: Superb location, real beach house feel and friendly staff
Summary: We were astonished how good quality this hotel was, relative to price. The rooms are styled in a true beach theme, with bright, light decor. The pool and whirlpool are a great addition and the hotel is only a 2 min walk to the waterfront or 10 mins to the beach/downtown Laguna.   We'll definitely stay here again, really great place.

Entire property felt very clean. They accommodate service animals as well.  We travel with a service animal which is also an emotional support animal. There is plenty of greenery along the ocean. The beach's in Laguna are also dog friendly as long as they are on a leash. I would say the town is very dog freindly and plan to return with our furry friend.

I stayed 3 nights in a KIng  room with a balcony. Lovely and friendly. Nice , hot Jacuzzi  and refreshing pool. I could see main beach in the distance thru my front window and a patch of blue above the roof lines in back. I liked the spacious room, tile sink and nice toiletries. I was able to leave the back door open for coastal breezes and the sounds of seagulls. Heisler park is directly behind the hotel: a nice way to walk down to the beach. The hotel offers free umbrellas, beach chairs and umbrellas. There is wine in the late afternoon and cookies and mild in the evening.. Lovely robes for guest use too.

Great place, close to the beach, staff was awesome, and the amenities that come along with the stay are great.  Especially loved the happy hour and the milk and cookies. Will be staying there again when I come back to southern Cali.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel with great ocean views
Summary: The hotel is ideally situated to access the beach and within walking distance of the restaurants and bars.  The rooms are modern and very clean.  The service from the front desk was outstanding with nothing too much trouble and there were nice touches such as “wine hour” and “cookies and milk”

This hotel is a GEM. Customer service went above and beyond. They truly care about their customers and it shows. The location was incredible, you can walk to so many great shops and restaurants. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Again, the level of service provided was incredible. I can't wait to come back.

My wife and I had an excellent time (3 nights) at Laguna Beach House.  The location is ideal, just a block from the cliffs and picnic beach.  Less crowded than main beach, and beautiful.  The property is impeccably clean and maintained.  Nice boutique hotel, quiet, staff highly attentive to guests.
Manager Response: Hello Alexander R,  Thank you for the amazing words that you said about us. Short and straight to the point! I do believe that our location is ideal, you get the best of both worlds. Whether you are looking for something quiet or want to join the crowd at Main Beach, we are a short distance to both. We look forward to seeing you again in the future!  Best Regards,  Steven K

Summary Heading: A VERY SPECIAL PLACE.....Brought the whole family 2nd time around
Summary: I wrote a review back in July,2016.  I could just copy and paste that same review today.  My family of 5 (3 teenagers, 2 adults) stayed here for three nights during the kids spring break because my daughter and I wanted to share our perfect experience with the rest of the family.  We needed two rooms, which was great for the family to have our own space in a boutique hotel and feel.  What makes this hotel SPECIAL are the welcoming amenities....morning coffee, teas, parfaits......fire pit for sunset by the pool.....complimentary wine hour 5-6pm....warm cookies 6-8pm, just to name a few.  The beach is steps away and LBH provides beach towels, chairs and umbrella's. Walk to Urth Cafe (we ate three breakfast's there), walking distance to town, walking distance to galleries.....
Manager Response: Hello 4185CrazyforBeaches,  I am glad that you didn't copy and paste and took the time out to write a 2nd review for us! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay both times that you were here. I remember the day you checked in and the day you checked out and you were happy on both occasions! We can definitely say that our guests makes our job SPECIAL! Thank you for being a part of that and we hope to see you again in the future!  Best Regards,  Steven K

Summary: The Beach House was fantastic! From our welcome to the rooms and the pool area, we really enjoyed it. They have so many special amenities ... a gas fire pit out by the pool, with great evening lighting, California oranges in a bowl in the entryway, wine in the lobby from 5-6, cookies and milk from 6-8 ... such nice touches! The beach themed decor was perfect too! The front desk people were wonderful... we would defiantly come back.

Wow, what a great place. Nicely decorated with a surfy beach vibe. Greeted with cookies and helpful staff. Comfy robes complete with patio with a slice of an ocean view. I can’t wait to visit this hotel again.

We spent 4 wonderful nights at the Laguna Beach Hotel upon the recommendation of a friend.  It was all and more than we expected.  Our plans included 2 days at Disneyland but we didn’t want to stay in Anaheim.  Turns out Laguna is an easy 40 minute drive there.  The hotel itself has a nice easygoing beach vibe.  The piped in music in the common areas is upbeat but relaxing.  Room cleanliness, decor and comfort is spot on.  Perks include a great heated pool and jacuzzi, fire pit, free nightly wine hour and warm fresh-baked cookies in the evening.  The view of the beach and sunsets is a plus as is the proximity of the hotel to nice restaurants and art galleries.  We definitely will be back!

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: My husband and I found the Laguna Beach House an excellent place to stay.  The room was unusually attractive and comfortable.  We enjoyed the comfortable furniture in the sitting area of our room as well as the good light.  The staff was extremely helpful.  Everyone we encountered was both pleasant and efficient.  The hotel is also in a very good location, very easy walking distance to the center of town, but a bit removed from the crowds. We also appreciated the beach chairs that we took to a nearby beach for a lovely afternoon.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, basic hotel in great location
Summary: I stayed at the Laguna Beach House for 5 nights. The room was very spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. Bathroom was large with lovely wood floor. We loved the hot tub and fire in the evenings. The location was fabulous, within easy walking distance of downtown & beach, and close to Heisler Park.   My only complaint is the single-use plastic coffee and water cups and containers holding the complimentary granola and yogurt in the mornings. This was very distressing for me. It would have fit far better with the hotel's surf/ocean vibe if they used reusables instead, especially considering that there were signs all over Heisler Park talking about plastic ocean pollution. It felt a bit hypocritical on the hotel's part.   Other than that, we loved it and will definitely be back at

Summary Heading: Best boutique hotel for young professionals in laguna
Summary: Love! Will be back many times! Staff members were amazing! Easy parking and warm cookies, coffee and tea made me feel at home! Room 114 had a sweet courtyard! Bring your suit for a jacuzzi soak after a long hike at near by crystal cove state park

Such a wonderful place to stay rooms are great clean super nice employees cant wait to go back to stay. Great location easy to walk to shop dinner beach. Could also take a taxi to nearby beach city's. Pool and fire pit also on property. Great hotel with parking a huge plus for a beach hotel.

Loved the hotel.  The location is ideal for a quick walk in the morning before going to the office.  The pictures are exactly like the room,  The staff was super nice and readily available.  I would choose to stay here again for both work and personal.

I book Laguna Beach House whenever it’s available and I have to stay in Laguna/Newport area for work or pleasure. The rates can get pretty high and they sell out during the summer months. I love the whole experience from check in to check out- the beds are super comfortable and the location is stellar. It’s just out of the chaos of downtown Laguna Beach enough to be tranquil - a short walk to the center of all the action. There is a pool and jacuzzi but what I love the most is the outdoor fire-pit after watching the sunset. It’s so fun to sip cocktails There is a historic tiki drink restaurant a block away, and delicious food options abound. The ocean is one block west of the property- take a bottle of wine at sunset! I love this property- great parking options and heaps of

Small, clean and great location. Fun vibe and excellent pool with hot tub. Nice touch with wine and fresh cookies around sunset for parents and kids. Easy walk to downtown Laguna, the beach etc..would go back.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay, Great Rates!
Summary: I always stay here when I visit my family in Laguna. The rates are always great and it's a very casual, comfortable vibe. The staff is outstanding. You can't beat the location as it's near main beach but far enough away from the central area so you don't hear people on the street.

Summary Heading: This is a little GEM of an Inn in Laguna beach
Summary: Wow, what an awesome find!    Starting at the cheerful and very helpful Peter, at the night desk we had a great experience.   Our room was clean and bright with a lot of little extra's, including a disposable underwater camera, surf books and paddleboard set (all individually priced, but very thoughtful).  We spend some of the evening around the poolside fire pit, before heading up to our very comfortable bed.  The next day, Troy directed us to the local beach and park which is exremely picturesque, we saw a number of dolphins playing in the ocean and breaching the surface.   The beach is a short stroll from the park and extends for miles.   Thanks for the great memories.

Love this beach-cottage vibe hotel! Easy walk into town, excellent cafes directly across the street from hotel. Very close proximity to Heisler Park and beach. Hotel has chairs to borrow to bring to beach. Nice to arrive back to hotel in afternoon to the smell of baking cookies & the fresh juice & granola/yogurt was an added bonus in the morning. Loved the decor in the rooms & the beds were very comfortable with high quality bedding. The pool area was pristine with comfy cushions on the chairs & peaceful music while lounging. Would highly recommend!

Lovely hotel, great position, friendly staff. Pool a little small but nice fire to sit by. Enjoyed the free glass of wine and the cookies were amazing. Would recommend the hotel again. Great place to see the sunset

Summary Heading: Average in some area. Great in others.
Summary: The location was the best part. You don't need a car. The staff is average. If you do stay, make sure you get a room on the second floor. i could hear people walking around upstairs and it woke me up in the middle of the night. Other than that, it's clean and decorated well. I loved the hot tub.

We LOVED the Laguna Beach House.  Location was outstanding - within walking distance of shops and restaurants (about 4 blocks); away from the very center of town and noise; and the walk to the beach was a block.  The walkway on the coastline is gorgeous and down to the beach was an easy slant down.  The hotel has beach chairs and umbrellas on loan which was a wonderful asset.  The room was spacious with a balcony.  stay on the upper floor to give you a better view.  pool area was cozy and nicely set up with a fire pit.  Defintely a great find.

I would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly because of the charming decor, cleanliness, friendly staff and it is close to cafes, shops, the Laguna Art Museum, art galleries and the beach.  They offer fresh coffee and yogurt with granola in the morning.  In the evening they treat you to your choice of wines and later freshly baked cookies are available.

Summary Heading: great vacation hotel without the steep price you can find in Laguna
Summary: Get a second floor ocean view room - worth it!  Clean and comfortable room and bed!  Can also be a little loud early in the morning if you wanting to sleep in and others are up early - or if you're not a deep sleeper.  I think it's a function of being a big older structure so it's not as sound proof as newer buildings.  You can turn the fan up and it solves the problem usually.

Really cute hotel with chill California vibes. The people at the front desk were super helpful. They included a free bottle of wine for my husband’s birthday and did a great job answering all my questions over the phone before our stay. We stayed on a Sunday night which made it especially affordable, and overall we loved our stay.

Summary Heading: Always! Always! My special place to Stay!!
Summary: I have been hesitate to write a review for Laguna Beach House because I want to keep this special place to myself!  LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!  The staff Peter, Annette, Steve the manager, Troy and everyone else who works there are very special!  They are attentive and always makes me feel good when I arrive.  I feel like I am at home!  When in Laguna, be sure to stay and let them know Dianna sent you.  When you stay, you will know why I love it so and you will keep coming back as well!!

Fantastic hotel.  Well kept, friendly staff, location is perfect.  Great small touches such as yogurt for breakfast.  Stylish interior and very comfortable.  I was here for businesss and staying here was way better than staying at a large chain hotel.

Rooms are decorated awesome!  Pics are a little deceiving of the ocean view, but it's not really to bad.    Super close to a lot of shops and even the beach.  Took a nice long walk as soon as I checked in to look at the town.  Most things were closed while I was there, but looking at the art through the window was great.   The staff working no matter the time were friendly and happy to answer questions.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious, and bed was comfortable. Free coffee, tea and yogurt in the morning, happy hour with wine in the evening, and cookies and milk before bed were all great touches.

Location good, staff nice, bed comfortable. I didn’t like that there is an extra charge for parking right on site, a $10 facility use fee, and an 18% city tax. Hessler Park is just a short walk away and it is beautiful.

Summary Heading: Booked a room, travelled for 4 hours, no room when I got there!
Summary: I booked   room at this hotel a few weeks ago, travelled from LA in hellish traffic, confirmed the room with reservations just before I got there, only to be told on arrival there was no room booking on their system. 3 sad, tired kids got back in the car to go home. Pathetic!!!!

Had a 2-night stay last weekend with girlfriends in Laguna.  The Laguna Beach House overall pricing represented best value for our budget and did not disappoint.  Rooms were clean & very modern, up to date.  Service friendly & efficient.  They provide you with complimentary granola parfaits & fruit for breakfast or do make recommendations for great cafes for breakfast nearby.  There is also a complimentary happy hour drinks and cookies & milk in the evening.  Great location as not far to walk to the main beach and shopping village.  Ocean view from the balcony room we had as well.  Highly Recommend and did not disappoint.

We stayed at the Laguna Beach House on 20 December 2018.  The feel of the hotel is so welcoming and extremely comfortable.  Beds were great and rooms had everything that we need, pool area was clean and comfortable.  Everything just a short stroll from the hotel..... but the big plus was that the staff were remarkable.  The Manager Steven went out of his way to accomodate us with a very late flight out of LA.  Nothing was a problem.  We will be going back and staying here again.  Thanks

The hotel was extremely nice, but the staff was among the very nicest we have ever come across.  So friendly and willing to help with any detail.  Our room had recently been redone and everything was perfect.  WE Would be delighted to return.

Loved, Loved, Loved the place!!  So clean and cozy!!  So close and convenient to walk to the beach, shopping and restaurants!!!  Loved all of the staff!!  They are so willing to please and do what ever they need to do to make your stay enjoyable!!  Thank you so much, and we will definitely be back to stay again!!!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and relax in Laguna Beach
Summary: If you are looking to spend some relaxing time in Laguna Beach, the Laguna Beach House is the place. The hotel is located not too far from the ocean front and the beaches. You can easily walk from the hotel to downtown Laguna Beach. The hotel has been recently renovated and offers clean rooms with a beach themed decor. A small and healthy breakfast (yogurt with granola and coffee) is offered in the lobby. There is also a happy hour during which you can have a choice of red or white wine. The pool area is nice and quiet. The front desk personnal is very nice and helpful. Parking is easy.

Summary Heading: Hats off to Laguna Beach House
Summary: Absolutely charming place. Exactly what I wanted, the cottage charm with the same service the Ritz would give you. Just a perfect location to walk to anywhere in Laguna Beach, including their amazing beaches. I could stay here forever. If only they would let me move in.

Stayed the night of January 11, 2018 for a quick getaway from San Diego. This was our second stay at this lovely, small hotel.  We were given one of the nicest rooms with a view of both the ocean and the homes on the hillside from our secluded balcony.  I think all the rooms are very similar on the inside.  They are a nice size and immaculate.  The front staff are extremely accommodating and if a particular room is still available, they do their best to fulfill requests.  The pool, jacuzzi and fire pit are all very well maintained.  The beach closest to the hotel is amazing.  You do have to go down a long flight of steps but the secluded beach is well worth it.  The coastline at this end has large rocks and caves and there is a path at street level that is lovely to walk along.

Really enjoyed my stay here. Had the coastal king and everything from the view to the bed to the nicely decorated room was fantastic. Very competitive pricing too. Service was good as well. Only reason they're not receiving 5 stars is because of their tendency to nickle and dime you (things like late check out seemed a little much) and the lack of some amenities commonly found at other hotels. But regardless, very much enjoyed my stay here. Would definitely recommend to friends and family

I was given a room that seemed like it was ON the highway...  the window was broken and didn’t shut.  To say the room was noisy is an understatement.  I immediately called down and asked to change rooms...  the man said thy were completely booked.  However when I went down to ask about restaurants, three people were checking in.  This place is a dump and if you want any sleep at all, stay at the Marriott down the road.

Had to get a break from the freezing KC weather and booked a New Years trip to Laguna Beach.  Booked directly on the hotel website for a best price.  It's a great location, steps from the beach (and they have beach chairs, umbrellas and towels you can borrow free) a quick walk down the hill to downtown and all the shops.  We stayed on the pool level and loved the small pool and large hot tub.  Also a fire pit for warming up on cool evenings.  All the staff were top notch, remodeled rooms were very comfortable.   Also, the Inn at Laguna Beach is a sister property and I highly recommend their rooftop terrace for a sunset viewing.  Heisler park is around the corner and the best way to walk along the beach for viewing.  All in all exactly what we needed with warmth, waves and
Manager Response: Dear mfjayhawk,  I am glad that you were able to enjoy the sunny California weather for a bit. I love our pool area and hot tub as you get to relax and enjoy the sun while getting some heat from the fire pit. Our sister property boasts a very beautiful view from their terrace, I believe the best in the city! Hopefully you can escape sooner than later from KC and join us once again.  Best Regards,  Steven K

Summary: This was our first time staying at Laguna Beach House. We loved the price, condition, room and location. The staff was very friendly we will stay there again. Very easy walk to downtown and the park. No need to look and another location. The sister location is great although more expensive.

Summary Heading: Great 24 hours in Laguna ! Cute hotel great location
Summary: Great location walking distance to town and great restaurants and walking paths to the beach ! Ate at urth cafe across the street a bit . Big clean rooms cute decor friendly staff would definitely visit again !

my only complaint was that the rooms were a bit musty.  otherwise, it's a great location to walk into town as well as the beach.  the rooms are simple but very clean.  it's a real "beach hotel".  the staff is wonderfully warm & inviting, as well as, well informed about things to do in the area.

Summary Heading: Lovely place to stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay in at Orange County and stumbled upon this beauty. Love that there are parking spaces (as I can imagine everyone drove in this part of the country). We went during winter but Im sure this place would have been more amazing during the warmer parts of the year. The rooms are spacious and the renovations made it more modern (which is the problem we encountered when we were looking for a place to stay in SoCal). Check in and check out was a breeze too. Highly recommended and would definitely stay again when were here.

This was the 2nd time this we stayed at this cute place. Beds were super comfortable and it was affordable and close to town. We enjoyed our stay both times and will stay there again next time we are in town.

Summary Heading: Business is always a pleasure when at the Laguna Beach House
Summary: Every element of my stay was superb!  whether it was the courteous front desk staff, the cookies at night, the wine for happy hour, or the coffee and parfaits in the AM.  hope to get back there soon.  Have stayed at other hotels in Laguna, and this exceeds expectations.

My room was outfitted perfectly with all of the essentials, bed was very comfortable and more than enough pillows! Casual table and chairs served as an easily converted working space too. Very clean room. Decorations throughout the property gave me that sense of being right at home. Ocean views from many locations of the property. Wine Hour AND Cookie and Milk time! They even provide you with all of your beach amenities (chairs, towels, etc.). The best part... the amazing staff. Very personable, engaging, and friendly. Felt like I was talking with long time friends that really cared about me. I won't be staying anywhere else when I come to the area.

I almost don't want to give LBH this rating. I have enjoyed all of my stays here and plan on going back. The rooms are very pleasant,clean and have a lot of light. The management is always very helpful and pleasant. Although there is no restaurant there are plenty around and they take care of your hunger with special treats! Enjoy your stay!

👍🏻 I enjoyed the stay at Laguna Beach.  The complimentary tea and pastry were an added bonus.  The Beach was was amazing in the am.  I would recommend the hotel to friends and colleagues.  Thanks again.

This hotel was the right price and the perfect location. Easy walk to down town and the beach.  Rooms were very nice and the amenities perfect. We would definitly recommend the hotel and will stay there again!

This was a very comfortable room. Although the view of the water was pretty distant, it was a wonderful experience. Great room with private balcony (overlooked not a great view) but public balcony very nice. Great pool, convenient parking plus cookies!! Innkeepers were extremely nice and accommodating!

This hotel has a great location, tasteful pleasant decor, and ocean views.  It is one block to a beautiful beach and to the sidewalk along the bluffs with stunning ocean and surf views.  Downtown Laguna Beach is a short walk away with its many shops and restaurants,

Summary Heading: a madeover motel but nice enough.
Summary: Our room was clean and fresh and had a little balcony.    Its not right on the waters edge, but a small block back.   You can easily see the ocean.  You get to the beach in seconds.    Lovely neighbourhood.    The staff were all attentive.   You get complimentary tea and coffee and yogurt and granola for breakfast.   Coffee machine in the room.   Nice fresh decor.   I think they also do a wine hour and milk and cookies which we didn't bother with.    They were kind enough to give us free parking as it was Thanksgiving.    I asked for a top floor room as I had seen people say the lower ones are noisy.   We slept well and the bed was excellent.  We stayed two nights and would have been happy with a third.

Clean, cozy, friendly staff, breakfast coffee, tea and yogurt with cereal. Cookies and milk and wine and cheese in the afternoons...free parking...overall great, hip place to stay where you actually enjoy being in the hotel!

My younger and daughter needed a little Laguna getaway so we drove up from San Diego and Loved our stay. The Laguna Beach house was quaint, in a great location, beautiful updated rooms with a beachy fun feel and a beautiful ocean view.

Stayed last night..Terrible terrible place to stay... got up 5am and wanted to leave.. worst noise blocking from upstairs, streets and outside, literally hear everything.. worse even, the window AC has enormous noise and turns on and off every couple min.. room located next to the amenities and in front of pool.. 6 am cleaning staff is working and you hear every single thing.. 2- hours restless sleep maximum.. anyways, if you can handle any enormous noise and sleep like a baby, maybe the discounted price would work for you. Otherwise, be ready for restless night here.  Btw, The sister hotel the inn at Laguna is not much better.

Moderate-sized hotel with super service. Extremely efficient and courteous staff. Located in the center of town, within walking distance of beautiful beaches and stores. Pool and small Jacuzzi which were in extremely clean conditions.Very enjoyable stay; will definitely return when back in town.

The location was wonderful right next to Heisler Park/The Pacific and walking distance to Laguna Beach shops and restaurants. All staff were welcoming, competent and professional. Room was clean and well maintained. They have a real focus on customer service!!   We would stay here again no doubt.

Summary Heading: Cosy little hotel on a great location
Summary: We spent four nights at the Laguna Beach House and truly enjoyed the stay. Very helpfull staff, great small pool area (with a fire pit) and a fantastic location. We had king room with a nice sea view (room 207) on the top floor. Room size was fine for two people allbeit a little cramed with furniture. It was nice and clean and the bed was super comfortable and it even had a small balcony with a table and two chairs. A bit worn and had a slightly moldy smell but nothing too bad. Simple youghurt and coffee breakfast in the motning and free wine at 5 pm.  All in all a very nice stay.

Sister property to the main hotel Laguna Beach Inn. The main difference is that Laguna Beach House doesn't have the direct sea/beach views, which isn't a huge deal as you can walk 10mins down the hill to the beach. This hotel is clean, smaller and assuming a little older. However, everything is new, clean and crisp....Should also mention the staff is easy and friendly with someone at the desk at all times. They have a happy hour from 5-6pm ( I think? ) and they provide a small breakfast each morning.(yogurt, coffee, tea, water) Later in the day they have what smells like fresh baked cookies each night. The rooms are clean, beds are good and each room has a surf-beach vibe. It's about a 5min/walk up-the-hill from the main Laguna Hotel Inn and found the walk between the hotels was

A charming, super clean and comfortable stay in a great location. Walk to town or beach. Enjoyed the sunset wine hour at sister hotel Inn at Laguna Beach but was happy to go back to the Beach House. More intimate and low key.

Great California Chic boutique hotel with perfect location.  Walk to all the galleries and restaurants.  Staff was very accommodating and professional, but not obtrusive.  The room was very comfortable!!

Renovation money not well spent.... All the floors squeek and creak so get ready to be woken whenever the room above is occupied. This was the case fot both rooms we had. The decision to use the construction funds on paint and pillows instead of repairing the basic structure is a big miss. The Motel vibe is nicely done but the take-away is a cheap flip property. Impossible to get a decent sleep... paper thin walls, AC broken. Way, way overpriced.

The hotel has great spacious and very clean rooms, (coastal level rooms have ocean views,) very friendly front desk staff, it's a 5 min walk to down town Laguna Beach, they have free wine hour from 5-6pm in the lobby and also in their sister hotel The "Inn at Laguna", little free breakfast is served from 6-10am, from 7-8pm its milk and cookie hour, highly recommend!!!

Summary Heading: Loved this place will probably go back.
Summary: Spent my birthday here and don’t regret it nice friendly people. Will be back! Everyone was so nice and helpful me and my boyfriend felt so welcomed, we recommend you stay here if you are looking for a hotel !
Manager Response: Hello F7319ISanah,  Thank you for choosing us to spend your special day with! Glad to know that we made a difference and that you will be back to our hotel. You are always welcomed back whenever you please if you want to stay or just stop in to say hi!  Looking forward to seeing you again!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary Heading: Loved this adorable beach hotel with the friendliest staff!
Summary: Went to Laguna for a friend's wedding and this was one of the recommended hotels.  This hotel could not have suited the weekend and the location any better.  The lobby is welcoming and super cute.  Rooms are bright, well appointed, efficiently laid out and have lots of thoughtful touches.  We loved all the communal offerings including morning coffee and tea, lobby happy hour, the central fire pit, the refreshing pool etc.  But most of all, the staff could not have been nicer.  And all for a reasonable price.  I was so, so impressed and would love to come back.
Manager Response: Dear Christina0812,  Thank you for choosing to stay here with us during your friends wedding. Congratulations to them and to you for finding a spot that you truly enjoyed. I too need the morning tea and coffee so I am glad that you got to take advantage of that. Please come see us again soon!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at the Laguna Beach House.  We arrived straight from Disneyland and the story continued as we stepped into a beautifully decorated lobby.  Full of California Kitsch. Our room was very clean and comfortable, from the cushy robe in the bathroom to our comfy bed.  We were able to leave our balcony door open at night and feel the cool ocean air. It was a quick walk to the beach that my sisters and I used to play on as children.  Towels, umbrellas and beach chairs were available for us to take to the beach.  It was just as we expected and we hope to return again.
Manager Response: Dear Claudia S,  Lovely to hear that you enjoyed your stay here with us at Laguna Beach House. Coming from Disneyland can definitely take the energy right out of you but im glad that we were able to keep that story going for you. Glad you were able to live out your youth at the beach with our towels and umbrellas.   Cant wait until you return back to the hotel!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: Very stylish, clean hotel. Very nice pool, jacuzzi and fire sitting area. Walking distance to downtown Laguna where there's tons of restaurants and shops. Beautiful walk along the water using the top pathway.
Manager Response: Dear Karli P,  I love the review you have about us. Short, sweet, and simple. Glad you were able to enjoy your time here and all of the amenities that we have at the hotel. Not many people know about the Heisler Park walk down to Main Beach so I am glad that you are letting everyone know!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: I ❤️❤️❤️ everything about Laguna Beach House!!! From the Incredible Staff to the beach, quaint accommodations ... the location literally steps from the water, delist restaurants & cute shops ... complimentary evening wine hour, morning tea & organic yogurt topped with granola ... pool area complete with jacuzzi & firepit ... I could go on and on. This truly has become my home away from home for business and pleasure 💖 Ask for Troy when you call or visit and tell him Steph said Hi 💫

Staff very friendly, go out of their way to please! Great location, clean, comfortable rooms, would definitely go back to. Within walking distance to beach, groceries and restaurants. Fresh baked cookies , milk and wine available nightly.

Wife and I first time stay.  Walking distance to everything in Laguna.  Love the walking path behind the hotel and down to the beach.  Rooms have recently been redone; and have a great beachy look and feel.  Just a fun stop for a few days; good value for the price

Summary Heading: Great Beach House to Relax and Enjoy Laguna Beach
Summary: Some quirks, but a homey, warm and very clean place to stay. Did not feel like a hotel.  Great location. Yogurt, granola and coffee in the morning and cookies and milk in the afternoon. Great location to walk to water activities, shops, coffee shops and restaurants.

I cannot say more about the service we received at the Laguna Beach House! They are amazing! They offer wine tasting and cookies and milk in the evenings. They provide a light breakfast. They have us beach chairs, towels, an umbrella, and toys for my son. It's a short walk to the beach. They offered great suggestions for food. And they have definitely made traveling with an 11 month old a million times easier! If you have a little one that will make you worry about noise, request room 201, it is isolated with the exception of the room below it. Everyone that worked there was so friendly and helpful, but I especially appreciated Anthony and Peter. I highly recommend, and we hope to be back!

We had a great experience and the service was excellent.  Had no problems staying here and very close to everything, shops, restaurants.  We could walk to all the stores and beaches. And we did walk to our favorite restaurant.

Rooms are very well maintained and clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Love the proximity to walking trails, beach, and restaurants. Also short walk to downtown Laguna Beach. Great homemade cookies for desert!

I don't give 5 stars lightly but it was excellent.  tlThe staff was friendly the room was lovely - Delux king with coastal view. There is a walkway on the side but not often used so it didn't bother us.  The parking is 15 £ a night but seeing the prices in the area it's a good deal.  Considering the price, location to beach and town, and room you can't go wrong.  Very quirky surfer style hotel with partial coastal view :-)

We stayed in room 209, a Deluxe King Room with a Coastal View.  The room itself was very nicely cleaned and decorated.  It was obvious that a pet had been in this room due to a stain on the carpet as soon as you enter.  The views from this room are wonderful, however the walkway in front of this room makes privacy limited, forcing you to keep your windows closed whenever possible.  The negative to this room is it’s right next to the elevator and a housekeeping closet.  As an individual who works in hotel management, I kindly give a thumbs up to this property, but suggest making parking for your guests complimentary.  $15 per day is a bit much considering the parking lot was half empty during our stay.  Other then that I plan to return.

Great location with a comfortably sized room. We had an ocean view with balcony. Complimentary cookies and milk in the evening. Walking distance to downtown area. Laguna Beach has great ocean coves and scenic walking paths.

Stayed 4 nights for our 40 year anniversary When we arrived at Laguna Beach House we were greeted immediately. The room was ready early and we went right to discover a very bright and well set up accommodation with a great coastal ocean view. They had wine every night from 5 - 6 pm and cookies and milk from 7-8 pm coffee and yogurt in the am. The desk attendants were very friendly and welcoming with advice for anything you needed to know. beach chairs, towels and umbrellas are provided and the beach is about 2 minutes around the corner and the pool and whirlpool along with a nightly fire pit added another nice touch. If your looking for a nice, clean, comfortable beds romantic atmosphere this is the place for you!!!
Manager Response: Hello BRIAN P,  Thank you so much for staying with us for your 40 year anniversary! It means the world to us that you would make us a part of such a monumental time of your life. I am so glad that you were able to take part of all the amenities that we have at the hotel. Such a great location to do all the things that you love doing in Laguna Beach! we look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel for future anniversaries!  See you soon!  Best Regards,   Steven K.

Summary: I won a 2-night stay in this hotel. It is conveniently located from the center of town, at 5 min from Urth Cafe for breakfast, and 10 min fro the main town. Very nice when going out for dinner and not having to worry about driving back. The Laguna Beach House and its personnel give you a warm welcome. The ambience is great. It's not top luxury, but it is clean, well-kept, good bathroom and bed comfort and it has a clear and pleasant beach vibe. I would recommend friends to stay here. It is one block away from the beach, within a 5 min. walk you are with your feet in the sand. Beach chairs, umbrella and towels are available for free at the hotel, another great little gesture to make you feel appreciated. Wine and cookies are served every afternoon and evening.
Manager Response: Dear Guido K,  Congratulations on the win for our hotel! I am glad that you were able to come and join us here. Thank you for mentioning our personnel here, they are a great bunch of people that loves servicing our guests to their full potential. Hopefully we made it onto your top 3 favorite spots to stay in Laguna!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel.  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: Extra effort has gone into making this place more than just a hotel. The decor is fun, staff super friendly and helpful and the extras like fire pit by the pool and wine/cookies make it a memorable and comfortable place to stay. Great value for the money.

Summary Heading: Best value in Laguna. Perfect location.
Summary: We've been visiting Laguna for many, many years and have watched the hotel rates skyrocket! I hesitate to review this hotel because I don't want it to become too popular and thus the rates increase. But this really is a terrific hotel. Comfortable beds, clean, great staff and a fantastic location. Please don't let your rates go crazy!!!
Manager Response: Dear andreay270,  I would love to keep this gem a secret too but of course we have to share the wealth with other guests! Thank you for being such a loyal guest for our hotel. We have transformed ourselves to what we think the guests would truly enjoy and that speaks for itself. We look forward to seeing you again soon.  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary Heading: "Book this hotel now - you won't regret it- SoCal surf culture at its best"
Summary: Friends told us to stay at the Surf & Sand, but at $600+ a night, that was not happening. I looked and looked and read all the reviews and picked Laguna Beach House. Less than $300/night, so my expectations were set for an average experience. After a long day of travel, we arrived during Happy Hour and that made us very happy! Drinking wine made check in a breeze! While my husband parked the car in the convenient underground garage, I went to the room 216 - and I was immediately impressed. Very beachy, spotlessly clean with welcoming white everywhere. The hotel is built around a pool, which we had no time to enjoy, but it looked very inviting. The room was spacious with a great bed, plenty of drawers and hangers, and lots of towels. There were beachy toys and surf books

Summary Heading: Lovely small hotel close to the beach
Summary: Laguna Beach House is a lovely hotel with a really relaxed vibe; there's coffee, tea and small breakfast laid out in the lobby each morning and wine at sundown. It is close to the beach and downtown Laguna. The staff were all really helpful especially Troy on the front desk who helped us with beach options and places to eat. There's no restaurant/bar at the hotel which we enjoyed but people looking for more all-inclusive experience might not (though there is Urth Caffe over the road that does big breakfasts). Great for a weekend away.

Summary Heading: Amazing small hotel close to the beach
Summary: Newly remodeled motel/hotel one block from the beach. The front desk people are really sweet and made us feel welcomed. The pool area is small yet nice. The rooms are very well decorated with a beach theme and even if you forgot something they got you covered.

Laguna Beach House is a stylish and clean "boutique" type hotel with very friendly staff, spectacular wine hour and yummy cookies.  We had a wonderful stay at beautiful Laguna Beach. I truly hope to return!

This was the last hotel I stayed at in California and I must say it was one of the best. It easily beat some hotel chains. The check in was easy and my room was fantastic. The bed was very comfortable and the seating area was as you would expect in a suite.  The room had all the comforts you need , coffee machine, safe, great air con and nice TV.  Did not take advantage of the pool or the fire pit which was lite and looked welcoming. If you walk about 100 yards you come across a small walk way on the headland which is a fantastic walk and has great views of the sea and beach. If I am ever back in Laguna Beach The Laguna beach House would be my 1st choice.

Summary Heading: Cute, comfy and so Laguna Beach
Summary: We were thrilled to find this nicely priced, adorable hotel in Laguna Beach, after looking at so many overpriced ones. The vibe is beachy and relaxed, but still very, very nice. All of the lobby staff were really nice and helpful (especially Troy!) We will certainly return to Laguna Beach and won't hesitate to book our stay at the Laguna Beach House.

Loved this little boutique hotel. The location is great, right on Heisler park. Rooms are redone, spacious and clean. Cool, beach vibe. Breakfast treats and an evening happy hour and snacks. I liked the ability to park ourselves. Can walk to all the fun shops and plenty of restaurants. The location gets it the fourth star, really.

My colleague and I flew in a day early for a conference because we HAD to go to Laguna Beach. This was my first visit, so had no idea what to expect. Since she had no preferred place to stay, I booked the Laguna Beach House. Aside from it being super clean and friendly -- and reasonably affordable -- the convenience made our trip so smooth, especially after being a little discombobulated after a long early morning flight and 3-hour time difference.   Of note -- the location was wonderful, just a short walk from the beach and the Cliff Walk, we could get everywhere we wanted to go. The LBH had a basket of towels, beach chairs and umbrellas right at the front desk for guests to use which was a great touch. Parking was in a ground-level garage for $15.00 per day, but they let us

My wife and I booked this hotel for a 6 night trip to Laguna Beach last week.  i was a little skeptical at first since it's a relatively small motel.  But the reviews were good so I took a shot and was so glad I did.  This place is awesome.  Just fantastic.  We stayed in Room 204 which is upstairs.  We didn't have a balcony but did have a little view from the window.  A lot of the rooms on the second floor have views and balconies.  Our room did have a couch and chairs for a sitting area and seemed a bit bigger than the other rooms I peaked into with balconies.  The balconies have a nice view of the ocean.  The people in the hotel are magnificent.  So friendly and willing to help.  You can park your car at the hotel for $15 a night which is not bad considering where you are.
Manager Response: Dear Rowlett9105,  What an amazing review we have here! Thank you so much for this. Our staff members loved having you here and we are glad we were able to meet your expectations for your 6 night stay. I am so very glad that you were able to partake in all of the amenities that we have here at the hotel, not very many people do. Glad you were able to get a room that you enjoyed. Our rooms do have different characters so I'm glad you enjoyed yours. We absolutely look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel with open arms! Until we meet again...  Best Regards,  Steven Khuon

Summary: Great location with very friendly staff!!!  Our family loved the oversized rooms and fresh baked  Otis Spunkmeyer cookies in the evening after the wine hour was awesome.  We loved starting the day with complimentary coffee and yogurt  parfaits.
Manager Response: Dear Sim C,  So amazing that you were able to enjoy all of the amenities we have here at the hotel! Not a lot of guests take full advantage of it but it looks like that wasn't the case for you. I also believe that we have a great location, short walking distance to pretty much everything here in Laguna Beach. Hopefully you make us your go to place in Laguna Beach!  Best Regards,  Steven Khuon

Summary: Very nice hotel, with good sized rooms which were clean and comfortable. The location is great for strolling to the centre and the beach, both being only a matter of minutes away.  You can hear your neoghbours, both the next room and one above, if your on the ground floor. The pool area is nice, with very comfy sun beds. There is plenty of parking.

Wanted to get away with my husband for the night and I don't like big expensive hotels. This place is low key, very nice, and CLEAN!! We stayed in a king with ocean view, just wished we could have stayed longer.

Great Place to relax and enjoy Laguna Beach..we were in Carmel for Pebble and decided to extend our trip .. drove down the coast to our old stomping grounds.. Laguna Beach House is awesome.. the only reason we left was there weren't any rooms available.. so reluctantly checking out in the AM..driving cross country back to the east coast.. great road trip
Manager Response: Hey there nisey767,  Thank you for making us a part of your road trip across the country! That means the world to us. We are glad to hear that you didn't want to part ways with us. Next time you make it out here, definitely let us know so that we can make sure we have enough room for you for as long as you want! Also, don't forget to check out our sister hotels in Carmel, they have the same charm that we do.  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary Heading: Refreshing, hip, anniversary getaway in Laguna Beach
Summary: Loved this little roadside motel, turned stylish hipster hideaway.  Charming rooms with cool amenities  -- clean and refreshing and quirky.  Nice little pool and spa -- all decorated and laid out to use the relatively small space really well.  Free tasty coffee and breakfast treats in the lobby; cheerful, smart staff.  Would definitely stay there again, especially for a short weekend trip like this.
Manager Response: Dear Amy W.  I agree with you when you say we are refreshing and quirky! Nice little tucked away spot that not very many people know about. That's why we're here, we need to get the word out! Thank you for the amazing review and we hope to see you again out the hotel! Until we meet again!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary: We stay here every summer.  The staff is kind and welcoming and the rooms are comfortable and pleasant.  The location is perfect.    A lovely stroll though Heisler park takes you along the coast to the beach and downtown, which has a great selection of restaurants.
Manager Response: Hello Mitch H,  I am so glad that we have you here every summer. Good to hear that the staff was kind and welcoming for you during your stay. We always love to help our guests relax and have the fun they deserve. Great way to stroll into downtown which is through Heisler park, that's also my favorite way to go as well. Looking forward to seeing you next summer!  Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary Heading: Home away from home! A superb hotel - recommended.
Summary: This is quite possibly one of the best places we have stayed in during our many trips to California. The front office staff are friendly, helpful and focused on providing guests with a warm, welcoming experience. Jason was an absolute star on the front desk and we are very grateful for him for looking after us. The hotel is a two level, motel style building which is clean, airy and beautifully decorated. We had an upper, corner room with a small balcony. The room itself had a king bed, circular table and chairs and en-suite bath/shower. The bed was very comfortable and we slept really well on the two nights we stayed there (we dropped in for one night, loved it so much we stayed another). The rates are superb for this place which also has a pool and fire pit, both situated in
Manager Response: Dear Chris G,  Thank you very much for the amazing review! We pride ourselves in the excellent service that we think we have and I am glad you think the same. Seems like you went into great detail about our rooms, which sure does paint a pretty picture for our future guests. Looking forward to seeing you on your next stay!  Best Regards,  Steven Khuon

Summary Heading: Great stay at Laguna Beach House
Summary: We had a great stay at the Laguna Beach House. I took my 2 daughters and we loved the vibe of the hotel. The staff is wonderful especially Steven and Anthony!!!They gave great restaurant recommendations and made sure our stay was enjoyable. They have beach towels, umbrellas, and chairs you can take to the beach. This is definitely a vintage motel with surfer chic motif. If you want a large sunbathing pool this is not for you. I love that they are redoing old motels and making them cool instead of tearing them down. We loved the granola and yogurt in the morning and complimentary wine and cookies and milk at night. You can't beat the location. Definitely book on 2nd floor. Missing Laguna already!
