Manager Response: Dear Texasgirl95,  It was great talking with you while you were here. I am glad that Anthony and I were able to help you out in every way possible. I am glad that you were able to enjoy our amenities here at the hotel as far as beach items. Definitely a storage saver when you're on vacation! Let us know when you back it back into Laguna Beach, you always have a place to stay at The Laguna Beach House.  Best Regards,  Steven K

Summary: This hotel was a lovely surprise. With the low number of "stars", I thought the hotel would be a little down-trodden or worn,  but it was a delightful--clean, crisp and very new feeling. The hotel and rooms were immaculate. I loved the room's decor and how bright and modern it was, with a wonderful seating area., lots of counter space in the bathroom, more than enough space for clothes, and a great little cabinet to store snacks. I loved that it also provided robes. The pool is small but the pool area is very well-kept, comfortable and relaxing.   A lot has been written about the staff and there's a reason for that: they are as friendly and as helpful  as everyone says.   I enjoyed the additional amenities of the nighttime complimentary wine, and umbrellas and chairs for the
Manager Response: Dear nancy k,  Thank you for the amazing review. Its wonderful to hear that we were able to exceed your expectations of our hotel. Our rooms are a pride of joy for us and we are glad that you were able to enjoy the new décor that we have. Wine hour and cookie time are the pleasures that our guests absolutely enjoy. Good to know that we were able to make your stay in every way. Looking forward to your next visit.  Best Regards,   Steven K.

Summary Heading: Not as cool as it seems
Summary: Very appealing website and design, nice staff and good location in walking distance to beach, however even if everything is nicely remodeled and decorated it remains a typical motel from the past with noisy air conditioning, small bathrooms, light walls and ceilings, dark rooms facing to the inside on the groundfloor (other guests can look into your room) and a very small pool. We paid over 300 USD plus resort fee plus parking fee. Would not stay in the hotel agsin.

Summary Heading: Great stay, friendly and warm staff
Summary: We had a lovely stay at Laguna Beach House and would definitely stay here again. Small and welcoming with fresh and lovely decor and a great location. The pool was lovely - the whirlpool and firepit were fantastic. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Hello Deborah73,  I am very glad to hear that you had a lovely stay here with us at The Laguna Beach House. We always love to hear that our guests enjoy our property as much as we do. We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel.   Best Regards,  Steven K.

Summary Heading: Good Value, Great Vibe, Excellent Location - Be Aware of Traffic Noise
Summary: We spent the weekend in Laguna and stayed here in a very large King room on the PCH side of the hotel. First & foremost, can't say enough good things about the large room, private patio, guys at the front desk friendly and helpful -- all awesome.  AND, if traffic noise keeps you awake, bring ear plugs or request a room that is not on PCH. We were there on a weekend, and the constant heavy traffic and revving of motorcycles was noticeable at night especially when the a/c cycled off and removed the white noise factor.

What a pleasant surprise. Its always hard when booking a room online and not being to familiar with the area. We loved Laguna Beach House so much. It was perfect for what we needed. Two adults and our tween daughter. We had the two double bed room. Beautiful, bright, clean room. We had a patio. The property is so quiet, friendly and safe we often kept our front door and patio door open to get the ocean breeze. Great pool. Very clean. We sat by the fire feature in the pool area while our daughter swam. The staff was so attentive and helpful. We interacted most with Steven and Petter, but every person we interacted with was great. Thank you for taking such good care of us. We didn't want for anything. Nice beach chairs, umbrella and towels to use at the beach. Easy walk to many

Such a great place to stay in Laguna. Very clean and really comfy beds. The staff here are amazing especially Steven and Peter. We stayed here with our 3 children and had 2 rooms that had internal access it worked perfectly... Thanks for great say .

Nice hotel within walking distance to the main beach and Broadway/Forest Street restaurants and shops. Nice coffee and yogurt/granola in the morning to get you started. Pool is smaller than appears in the photos but clean and enjoyable. Staff is very friendly and the hotel was very quiet at night.

Wine in lobby at 5, cookies at 6. Free Yoghurt/granola and coffee/tea in AM.  Views are not the best. Very clean tidy rooms. Good staff. Parking $15/day. Good A/C. Good pool. Close to center of town, great location. Quiet.

Easily I can say this is the most delightful hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff goes far beyond to make your stay the best! The beds are so comfy! The morning treats are a delight! Stay here! You will be very very glad you did!   If even a teeny tiny thing goes wrong, they immediately do everything possible to remedy it quickly and professionally! The decor is a delight!   I used the hot tub and it was at the perfect temperature! Relax and enjoy! The views of the ocean from our 2nd floor room were spectacular! The little Extra you pay to stay here you reap in HUGE rewards to make it the best time ever!
Manager Response: Dear Lori W,  Being the most delightful hotel is what we strive for and I am glad that this happened for you. Our staff is truly one of a kind and yes they do try to go above and beyond for our guests as our guests are our extended family. The Laguna Beach House is our home and I am glad that we were able to share our experience with you.  Looking forward to welcoming you back to the hotel!  Best Regards,  Steven Khuon

Summary Heading: A great place to relax and unwind
Summary: I have stayed at several places in Laguna Beach over the years including summer rentals through VRBO.  I found Laguna Beach House superior to most that I have experienced.  From the check-in process with Dylan who was very friendly and accommodating, to Peter and Annette who got us our beach towels, chairs and umbrella (nice touches, by the way) we were catered to by all who work there.  Yenis did a great job cleaning our room and giving us a few extra towels as requested.    What helped make this place for me was the location - trolley stops on various streets surrounding the hotel - we rode it to and from every day to explore Laguna.  The beach is just a block away, but we certainly had a nice view of it from both the front balcony out our room entry door, but also from our
Manager Response: Good afternoon sandrajv123,  Thank you for such the detailed review of how your stay went. I am glad that you are able to call our place superior to the others. We do have an amazing team here from our Front Desk Agents to our Housekeeping staff and I am glad that you were able to see that in them as well. I will make sure that our team is well aware of how much they made a difference in your stay.   Best Regards,  Steven Khuon

Summary: We loved our room, spacious and clean and modern. The location is perfect, short walk to the beach. Plenty of parking which was a must for us, we were tired of the CA traffic jams and wanted a few days with no driving. Nice light breakfast was complementary. The only slight complaint I have is that there is noise from the room above, more soundproofing needed. If I came back to this region I would stay here again but request a top floor room
Manager Response: Dear loobylooLeicester,  Thank you so much for the kind words. We do love our location of the hotel as it sits perfectly centered to a lot of walking destinations. We also are tired of the California traffic out here but it has become less and less noticeable for me. When you find yourself back in Laguna Beach and decide to stay with us, we'll make sure that you are on the top floor.   Best Regards,  Steven

Summary: My family and I needed a stay-cation and decided to book at the Laguna Beach House based off their reviews. We normally travel to San Diego to get away. We stayed in the Coastal King room. The room had a cozy and relaxing feel to it. Everything was clean, perfect lighting, spacious enough for a family of four, and best of all...an ocean view.  It was amazing to fall asleep and wake up to the sound of the ocean.  Advice to travelers: check out their wine hour (and delicious cookies for little ones), cute little shops all around the hotel within walking distance, morning walks/workouts on/near the beach  The front desk/housekeeping staff were genuinely sweet and smiled every time we walked by. Other hotel guests were very friendly and some were even humorous.   The location was

Summary Heading: Charming hip hotel in great location!
Summary: The Laguna Beach House is a fabulous place for so many reasons! The staff is fantastic!  The decor is beachy, comfortable and fun, with fun extra amenities like coffee and parfaits in the morning, wine at happy hour and cookies in the evening! They even provide chairs, towels and umbrellas for your beach time! The rooms are awesome...the pool is lovely and we loved sitting by the the fire pit after we got out of the hot tub! The location is great too...a 5 minute walk to a pristine beach and another short walk in to the center of town!  LOVE this hotel!
Manager Response: Good afternoon hopebake4,  We do also love our décor here as it makes us feel that we are unique in so many different ways! I am glad that you were able to take advantage of all the amenities that we have here from wine hour to cookies and also to our beach amenities. I am very thrilled to hear that you LOVE this hotel as I also LOVE the hotel. Please come visit us again soon, we would love to have you back at The Laguna Beach House.  Best Regards,

Summary: This hotel has a vintage feel with a recent facelift, and is located on the Las Brisas side of Laguna (i.e., north of Main Beach) right on PCH, but on the west side .  It is not fancy, but quite comfortable and nicely appointed.  We were able to walk everywhere - beach, shops, restaurants - never even moved the car. The staff was so accommodating... one of the rooms we were assigned at check-in was sort of dark and back in a corner, situated so that people walking down the corridor seemed like they were coming toward us (weird, I know, but I am saying this to point out it's not like it was dirty or there was anything major wrong with the room) and they moved us without any problem.  Staff were all so nice.  Everything is pricey in Laguna, so having good service helps you feel

We loved our stay at Laguna Beach House.  The rooms were clean and comfortable and the pool area was cozy and relaxing.  The staff was friendly and welcoming.  There were lots of little touches (like bathrobes, beach towels, beach toys, wine hour, and milk/cookie hour) that made this a perfect fit for our family.  We'll definitely stay here again if we're ever back in Laguna Beach, CA.

booked on line way in advance 3 night  stay $1300 way too much for what is offered. I see if i booked today it would be $159. wish I could check out and start all over. for this kind of money it should be on the beach.  cute, clean, minimal, barely any ocean view.  do not recommend. biggest plus pet friendly. however not traveling with a pet. rooms dont smell like pets, good thing. self parking $15 per day.

that was lovely boutique hotel. the  rooms were so clean. the advantage of this hotel is in the center of laguna, and near  the coastal. definitely you should watch the sunset. its the best in the world.

Flew to LB to enjoy some sunshine - turns out it was the coldest and rainiest weekend in years!  Good news is, I still liked this place!  I had a wonderful corner room on the second floor. Bed was comfy. Renovations are well done.  Loved the free coffee and yogurt in the lobby at breakfast.  (I had to miss the evening wine events.)  The location is just a few minutes from the middle of town.  For me, that is not a bad thing.  It's a short walk to the beach and a really nice walking path.  Keep in mind this is a small property with a very small pool area.    Overall, Loved it, looking forward to going back when there is a bit of sunshine to enjoy.  Maybe I'd like the pool a bit more ;-).

I spent a few days at this hotel with my husband and our dog. I have only good things to say about it, starting with the very accommodating staff that allowed us to check in 45 ins earlier since we were already in Laguna, to the clean, surf-themed design of the rooms, the easy access to our room directly from the parking lot, to the little touches like wine and cookie in the reception. We will definitely come back. Think we have a new fav in Laguna!

We visited in January 2016 and it all went well. I would recommend a room on the 2nd floor to reduce noise.  The parking is great and easy compare to other resorts in the area. The Pool and fire pit are charming and very private. walking distance to the beach and severa local cafes.

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel in Laguna Beach
Summary: I ABSOLUTELY love this Hotel. I highly recommend this Hotel because the staff is so friendly especially Peter & Troy. They have been so kind to me and my fur baby. They have helped me with anything I've asked with a smile on their face. The Hotel is so beautiful, extreamly clean, bright and positioned in a great place. Around the corner is a lovely park and the beach. Next door is a massage and nail place. Restaurants are close. Everything is walking distance. I will not stay anywhere else. Every penny is wortth staying here and there is no such thing as a bad room.

We love to travel and prefer to stay in boutique places with character and charm. Laguna Beach House was just what we were looking for. It's a charming, beachy place a block away from Heisler Park and the Beach. We walked there every evening to watch the sunset.   Our room was delightful with a very white and airy style and a surfboard mounted above the bed. We chose a Coastal Level King (top floor) and could see the ocean from our room. Bed was comfortable, TV had plenty of channels and Yenes kept the room spotless.  We were well taken care of at the Laguna Beach House and really appreciated the friendly staff, particularly Peter at the front desk who greeted us and was very helpful. When there was a question on our bill, the manager, Peter, took care of it for us in a very

We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Was well furnished in a beachy Hampton style. Very clean and not your standard boring hotel....boutique style with great pool and sunning area. Great little extras like wine at happy hour and cookies and milk. The ambience of the room and hotel is spot on. Great position to the Main Streets of the area and restaurants as well as the beach. Wish we stayed here longer. Was the best part of our 2 week trip. Love Laguna.

The hotel seemed to be more empty than half when we stayed yet the gentleman who checked us in placed us below an occupied room where the guests woke up very early, around 6 am or so if not earlier, and shuffled and jumped across the room for an hour and a half. Nevertheless, because the hotel is charming we decided to book another night but had to leave due to a medical emergency. We were supposed to check out at 1 pm, but actually checked out around 2:30. They charged us $50 late checkout PLUS 2 days parking fee which I though was unkind given the circumstances of our early departure.

Summary Heading: LOVE LOVE LOVE! the perfect place for a family vacation!
Summary: We stayed at the Laguna Beach House for the week of my wedding and we absolutely loved our stay! Flying across the country and never seeing this hotel, we had a tough choice to make to pick a hotel for our wedding guests that was affordable, good location (aka walking distance to main street Laguna), clean and comfortable and we sure got everything and more! It was such a cute hotel, beachy vibe, sidewalk trail to the beach, and incredible staff. We booked a room block and the entire process was so easy thanks to Alex Wilhelm, Jonathan Go, Vanessa Lopez and Troy at the front desk was sooooo incredibly nice!!! They responded to my emails super quickly, kept in communication via email up until the week of the wedding incase we had questions/concerns/requests. They even had a cute

Summary Heading: A lovely hotel with a perfeckt location
Summary: This hotel is a very sharming place to live in Laguna beach. It is not an exlusive hotel, but it has everything you need for a comfortable stay. The people that works in the hotel is more than helpful and very friendly. In the evening they will light up a lovley fire by the pool were you can sit and enjoy with a nice glass of wine. I really recommend this place to people that want to se the hart of Laguna Beach.

Spring break in Laguna was awesome thanks to the Steven, Peter, Troy, and Jason at the Laguna Beach House.  From check-in to check-out these four gentlemen were the best.  They were full of knowledge of the best restaurants, helpful with ride options, knew the live music scene, and were simply just polite and welcoming. I'll definitely be back again. This was my second visit to this wonderful hotel.  It's clean, clean, clean! The rooms are spotless and beautifully decorated. One can't beat the central location. I walked everywhere and Ubered back for $5 late night.  They offer a free wine hour, breakfast, and fresh cookies.  I can't wait for summer to return.  Thank you for the best Spring Break vacation.

I stayed here for the weekend for my birthday and I cannot rave about it more! It is a perfect, hip Laguna Beach getaway. I think it was once a motel but they re-designed it into the coolest little spot in Laguna. I loved the surfer/driftwood inspired design. It captured the essence and soul of that quaint town that Laguna Beach is; as opposed to those large mega hotels with no character. We literally pulled up, parked, and were at our door. The complimentary happy hour was amazing and the hotel in the best location. Walking distance to downtown, close to the best cliffs and tidepools, and close to art galleries and restaurants. I will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Be clear, this is a MOTEL
Summary: We stayed for three days before moving onto Santa Monica. It's in a great location, it's cute and clean and very surfy. But make no mistake, this is not a hotel. This is a very small glorified motel. The rooms are very small, the bathroom is very small, the common areas are very small, there are no amenities. Frankly a bit difficult to pay what we did for so little. But the staff was great and like I said, very clean which is huge. The pool area is absolutely tiny. Smaller than most backyard pools. So plan on being on top of total strangers if you want to use it. I cannot imagine there are more than 2-3 rooms with even partial ocean views. You can only see the ocean from the pool if you stand on a piece of furniture. The picture from the website is very misleading, it's taken
Manager Response: Dear 1KristenV,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience while visiting us. I was happy to see that you found the staff great and the property and rooms clean. But I was sorry to read that we didn't deliver the 5-star experience I know we are capable of. It's true that we are not an oceanfront property, which is why we only sell coastal view rooms. But the majority of our second floor rooms do have views of the ocean. Also for amenities, we have WiFi, a nightly wine hour, nightly milk and cookies, breakfast parfaits and coffee and tea included with your stay. We also have beach chairs, umbrellas and toys for the young ones free of charge from the front desk. I am so sorry we didn't do a better job of letting you know about these amenities and that we didn't seize the opportunity to find the perfect room for your expectations. I hope you can give us another chance. Thank you once again for the honest feedback, and please know we take it to heart.   Warm regards,  Casey Area General Manager

Summary Heading: Paid for Ocean View, got a Pool View
Summary: I made sure that I will get a room with Ocean View not their Pool View room. Got there and received the worst interior room next to the elevator and looking at the pool. Even the view of the pool was blocked by the wall to the stairs that lead down to the pool. This room was physically located the furthest from the side of the ocean.  One of the employees did say that people usuall complain about the room being given put as a Pool View one when their website shows a different corner room as the one with the Ocean View.

We really enjoyed two nights at LBH. The rooms are very comfortable (love the robes), convenient location to beaches and restaurants, and specific details (such as the fire pit, chess set near lobby, and morning coffee and yogurt)made this a favorite. Staff were cheerful and quickly helpful. Would love to return!
Manager Response: Dear Cathy,  Thank you so much! We would love to have you back as well. We truly appreciate the kind words and most of all we thank you for being such a lovely guest. We hope to see you soon.  Warm regards,  Casey Area General Manager

Summary: Really loved this place.  Cute and retro.  Our room was very clean and next to the pool.  All the rooms over look the small pool, hot tub and fire place.  The location is great!  You are in the center of everything.  Even though the hotel is right on HWY 1 it is quiet.
Manager Response: Hello Lbraafladt,  Thank you for the wonderful words about our hotel. Our stylish décor actually reflects the imagery of our owner. I am glad that you were able to enjoy the rooms and your time by the pool. Please do come back and enjoy some fun under the sun at our beautiful property.   Best Regards,  Steven Khuon Hotel Manager

Summary: The rooms are so pretty, clean, spacious and the beds are so comphy. I enjoyed the pool by day and hot tub and fireside at night. They offer delicious coffee in the morning with yogurt and granola, and in the evenings they serve wine and cookies. Its only a three minute walk to the prettiest part of Laguna's Heisler Park/beach and a short walk into town.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Cant wait to go back!

Summary Heading: Relaxing, well appointed property a block from the beach.
Summary: From Steven Khuon at the front desk to  Yenis, excellent housekeeper, the staff went overboard to make sure we had a pleasant stay.  We were directed to a great local restaurant, which perfectly fit our criteria.  Our every need was seen to.  I would recommend this to anyone wanting a great place to stay in Laguna Beach!

Great place to stay! We would most definitely would stay here again! The staff was great, and the property was close to the wate and very clean. It was a great value! Restaurants within walking distance.

Great location, cute rooms and friendly staff. We really enjoyed our stay. Our room was well appointed, it is near all of the restaurants and shops but not noisy. It was a great stay. Staff is friendly, coffee is great and although the pool is small and the view is distant, in Laguna, it doesn't matter...you're such a quick walk to everything. Next time we'll try the wine hour.

The rooms exceeded my expectations. The beds are very comfortable and the overall beach house theme is wonderful. Even though it was cold the days we were there we enjoyed our stay very much. They had a nice fire pit just outside our room near the pool. A short walk to the beach and eating spots. Nice staff ... I loved the morning coffee.
Manager Response: Dear Karen M,  Thank you for the kind words about our hotel. We do take pride in our hotel and I am glad that you were able to get the chance to stay here with us. Hopefully you are able to make your way back to Laguna Beach House so that you can have some fun under the sun! Looking forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: My husband and I enjoyed an overnight at Laguna Beach House. The hotel is bright and welcoming and the front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 2nd story pool level and was airy, well decorated and very clean. Our balcony was private and overlooked the treetops with a bit of an ocean view - the shoreline is a block away. The pool area is nice and very inviting, with a fire pit and seating along with a hot tub. The only negative was a bit of a musty smell in the room, seemingly from the carpet. In spite of the slightly damp smell, we would stay again. Loved the wine in the late afternoon and the breakfast yogurt parfaits. The bedtime chocolate chip cookies must be popular since they were gone when we went to get some around 10pm! Beautiful Heisler Park and

This must have been a relic deteriorating while LB had a down swing. This well timed renovation has the place suited for the bit of resurgence that seems to be happening in LB. It has a nuevo days of old feel - stucco, surfboards, faux wood veneer...but it works. The bed was comfy. The room was clean. The location was most excellent! Right around the corner from H park and a very short walk to down town. Quick drives to all other points. Steve at reception was informative and a nice guy- as were all the other employees. Give this place a stay and help them remain in business - a small guy vs a chain or a resort!

Summary Heading: Cosy, modern, immaculate and feels even better than home.
Summary: It was as if I walked into a show room for modern bedroom accommodations.  Very bright, airy, lots of natural light and nice little touches to make you feel at home, but pampered.  Love the wine hour to collect and meet people as well as the light breakfast in the lobby - and had the weather been better I would have frequented the offer to join the wine hour on the rooftop of the sister Inn (the Inn at Laguna - which I have also enjoyed in the past).  Just lovely - and the price was very reasonable (although it was off season).

Summary Heading: Charming updated small hotel in a great location.
Summary: This hotel is very small but has recently been updated with a surfer feel. The rooms are very clean and tastefully decorated, updated bathrooms with shampoos... bathrobes and numerous amenities to purchase (radios, books, paddle boards all with a surfer theme). The view from the decks is not the best but you can see the ocean and park. The swimming pool is small but nice with a hot tub and also gas fireplace. Over all the property has a nice beachy feel.

My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate Valentine's Day. The staff was immediately helpful when they found out we were out of town and provided us with a map, a book of activities, and a book filled with restaurants. We felt very welcomed, there was even wine tasting, milk and cookies, and granola and yogurt. Overall we were really satisfied.

great place, laid back & clean.  beds are comfy, staff is friendly and our dog was very welcomed.  ample parking.  rooms are well supplied with mini bar options of you choose, but I suggest you carefully count everything upon check in, and after cleaning.  we stayed 2 nights, and didn't think much about that until we were charged for 2 items we didn't even think of drinking.  the guy was polite & reversed the charge, but he somewhat implied we were trying to get something for nothing.  it's all about the tone, and he could have done a better job.  I'm sure people try to do that, yet, perhaps not have mini bars or a better dialogue when dealing with guests.  the other staff at the desk were flawless. close enough to the beach & Parkway.  quiet over night.  clean pool & spa and

This is a darling small property in the middle of Laguna beach. The room was very clean, the pool and hot tub awesome and the people were friendly. The only downfall was the paper thin walls and ceiling. Make sure you don't stay on the first floor. We weren't sure if it was a herd of buffalo or river dancers that stayed in the room above us.

It was our anniversary and so we were looking to just get away for a few days. We found this place and we're not disappointed. Nice staff, super clean and spacious. We stayed in room 216 which is a corner room and we chose it because we wanted the balcony but my advice would be to not spend the extra money and instead spend it at the cute cafe down the street and have breakfast there together. There is an ocean view if you stand on the balcony and look over many apartment homes but you're better off walking along the beach or the walkway and enjoying the view there.  We sat in the jacuzzi which was nice and perfectly located. Great waking location to everything as well. Enjoy!

If you're looking for comfort and quiet, this is the place!  The bed was super comfortable, like sleeping on a cloud.  The shower was perfect, lots of pressure and nice and hot!  And after four days in a hotel across the street from Disneyland, it was so nice to stay somewhere quiet for a change.  The staff was awesome and it's close enough to all the galleries, restaurants and shops in town that you can just walk there.  Two thumbs up!

We received a gift of a one night stay from our daughter and son in law for Christmas. What a great night! My son in law called ahead and was able to get us early check in and the best available room! When we found out the place was pet friendly, that made it even better. We brought our Cavalier  King Charles and it was just an awesome stay. We had an ocean view and a pool view with lights strung all around. We took advantage of the free wine from 5-6 p.m. and enjoyed the fire pit! Troy was on duty when we checked in and he was awesome. He made us feel welcome and special from the moment we arrived and was there the next day when we checked out. We felt like we made a new friend. In summary, this was a great experience and I would highly recommend The Laguna Beach House Hotel! I

The Beach House is in a prime location in Laguna Beach right near restaurants, shops, and access to the Pacific. The rooms are always in great condition and the staff are super friendly. Head around the corner to find a walking path with incredible views over the ocean!

I stayed here for one night on a coastal road trip. We arrived around 10 PM and immediately fell in love with the fresh, surfer themed lobby decor. When we inquired about a place nearby to order some wine, the desk worker gave us a bottle of wine and some cookies to share around the pool deck fire pit. What a nice surprise! The room felt fresh with white walls/linens and tasteful, bright colored accents. We loved the morning coffee and yogurt. This hotel is in the perfect location for walking along the cliffs/beach. There are multiple shops and restaurants within a couple blocks.. What I liked the most about this hotel was that the building itself is clearly older, but they updated it in such a way that the the charm of the original hotel is not lost with the remodel. This was

Summary Heading: Beautiful room in a gorgeous hotel and service to match
Summary: We were thrilled to discover this beautiful hotel in Laguna Beach. We previously stayed in the Inn At Laguna which is a sister hotel and we loved it there but the rooms were very expensive this year and the dollar rate to sterling was very poor so we had to shop around. We were thrilled that we did as we would never have experienced this gem of a hotel in a perfect part of town. We had a king room with partial sea view and it was just gorgeous. The view of the water was beautiful and we had a view over the pool area which was just perfect. Parking was very reasonable and the service from the front desk was absolutely superb from check in to check out.  The wine hour was lovely with complimentary wine and time to chat to other travellers where we shared information on good places
Manager Response: Hello Morsiemike,  Thank you for the wonderful review. We also do believe that our hotel is one of the more beautiful ones in Laguna Beach! We appreciate you taking the time out to write us such an amazing review. Our amenities at the hotel I believe are second to none so please when you are back in town, come stay with us again and enjoy the same amenities as you did last time!

Summary: Loved this place.  The rooms are super-comfortable and its five minutes from the beach.  Parking is easy and reasonable.  The staff was laid-back and helpful.  I looked at a lot of places, as we were staying Christmas week there – an annex to family in Irvine.  This one stood out as being both reasonable and accessible, which also having a bit of luxury to it.  It's right on the main boulevard in Laguna, and you can walk to everything you need.  The room was ace – that California beach vibe distilled into a large, inviting space.  The rooms here are generous in size – more like small studio flats.  Free fast wifi.  Great water pressure.  All the bits you want.  The only downsides were that the HVAC units are quite noisy, and the bluetooth radios make no sense.

We stayed at this hotel as a party of five occupying two rooms around the pool , lovely bright rooms decorated with a surfer vibe. The hotel is in a great location just a short walk to the center of Laguna Beach with lots of shops bars and restaurants. This hotel is quiet and peaceful location yet so close to the center you can park your car in the hotel car park and forget about it for your entire stay. The hotel staff are absolutely excellent providing you folding beach chairs and towels should you wish to make the short walk to the beach. A light complimentary breakfast of granola yogurt and fresh coffee is provided every morning and and complimentary wine is provided by the hotel every evening between 5-6. All in all for value for money I think Laguna beach house is the

Great accommodations with a beautiful view.  We were overnighters, but wished we could have stayed longer.  Friendly staff and nice amenities.  When we again visit Laguna Beach, we will return to Laguna Beach House.

Summary Heading: Fresh/surf style property and super friendly staff!
Summary: This hotel is an adorable, super clean surf-styled place. Awesome location. We parked our cars and walked to everything all weekend.  The staff couldn't be more welcoming and helpful.  We will be back for sure!

Spent two nights here in November. The hotel rooms themselves are decent and have been recently remodeled. However, I had a toilet that did not work properly which I notified the front desk of twice during my two night stay. I then killed three cockroaches my second night there. I let the front desk know of this when I checked out the next morning. The clerk at the front desk seemed like it was a big deal and said she would have the manager call me. After waiting almost a week with no call back from the manager I contacted the hotel. He was polite and offered to refund one nights stay. Because I booked through trip advisor which is a third-party the hotel could not directly refund me the one night stay. I was given the runaround a little bit by trip advisor and get a room.
Manager Response: Hello 3kidtravels,  I am very sorry that you did not have the most pleasant stay at our wonderful hotel. I would like to apologize that the refund did not take place. I have contacted them and they assured me that this would happen. I want to make sure that this does happen for you. If you wouldn't mind, I would love to get in touch with you so that we can work out all the kinks. You can reach me at 949-497-6645 or Skhuon@thelagunabeachhouse.com, looking forward to hearing from you.

Summary Heading: Fun "dog" hotel that allows Humans too!!!
Summary: What a super place to spend some time with family or friends or solo! And dogs very welcome. I saw families, kids, couples and solos and a lot of wagging tails. I hosted my family here with four rooms and we had so much fun. WALK to everything! Free wine at 5pm at this hotel OR the rooftop bar at the sister hotel up the street. Free cookies and milk! Free yogurt and coffee! They do charge $10 per day for the perks but its worth it. I did NOT like paying $15 a day to park! The rooms are very well done - crisp, white, lovely. Bathroom is fine - very open and charming. The front desk team is super- very friendly- thanks Annette, Jay and Troy. I would go back here as so much to do the pool, fire pit and ocean view is fabulous. Have fun and make sure to bring your human with you if
Manager Response: Dear Sandra,  I love the title and the review. Yes, dogs are allowed to bring their humans with them :) So happy you enjoyed the room, wine hour and awesome team! We hope your pooch will bring you back again soon.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: If you enjoy a surfing motif with a classic flair, this is the hotel for you.  The rooms are crisp white with beach style ambiance.  The dark wood floors complement the facility.  I especially love the Happy Hour, Cookies and Milk Hour and the great morning yogurt.  I would definitely go back.

Wonderful hotel.  Close to all attractions.  Nicely renovated rooms. Pool and hot tub are nice.  Close to beach and trolley.  Was a good place to stay for pageant of the masters because trolley runs between the hotel and pageant.

In researching my trip to California...I was looking for a small lodging centrally located, with a hip (ish), upscale vibe....without the upscale price tag! Laguna Beach House gets it right! Genius conversion from what appeared to be a pretty standard "motel" layout to a comfortable "boutique". (overused term I know!) Rooms were SO fresh and different from what I've experienced, from even the top-end luxury properties...it was disorienting!  Great size and style!  Bathroom remodel was top-notch...liked the subway-tile shower and the patterned sink! Smart marketing in play with branded items throughout the room for purchase (although price point for beach bag, robe etc.were rather steep!) Lobby / Exterior areas well kept and interesting with lots of individual touches.  Pool area

Summary Heading: wonderful experience, suited our small family's needs perfectly
Summary: we stayed here for 3 nights in October 2016. As always, my wife had her reservations about going with a "no name" place as opposed to a safe chain like the Holiday Inn. We were really impressed on arrival at the cleanliness, aesthetics, and the ambience. the staff was very nice and very accommodating. we have 2 small kids and they even provided 2 cribs for us free of charge! I wouldn't go expecting a million dollar view or beach access, nor did I expect that since i wanted an affordable place to stay. the exception to that is the southwestern-most room which may have a pretty good ocean view although i didnt stay in that room so i dont know for sure. the walk to the main laguna area wasnt too bad, area felt safe. parking was an extra $15/day which is a minor downer. they provide

Summary Heading: Wanted to spend the weekend at the beach
Summary: This is NOT the place for couples. We experienced a lot of children playing and having fun which was great. As a couple we visited other couples around the fire pit in the evening we were told to be quiet. Five adults were talking. One couple were from Denmark they will not be back. We love Laguna beach but will not be staying there again..
Manager Response: Hello _diana4098,  Thank you for recently staying with us at The Laguna Beach House. I am saddened by the fact that you thought our place is not the place for you. We do get a lot of families that come to our property but also a mixture of couples as well. I thank you for giving us a try but definitely would encourage you to come back to our property. Thank you for the review and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Very nice staff who will accommodate as best they can to ensure guest satisfaction.  My wife and I visited and had requested a specific room. When we arrived, it was not available. They gave us a great alternative room, and a bottle of wine. Problem solved.

This hotel is a gem. Friendly staff in a perfect location. We can't wait to go back for another visit! Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Just a short walk from a lovely beach, perfect spot to watch the sunset. I would highly recommend the Laguna Beach House.

Hotel is in a great location - convenient to all.  But, while the facility is nice (new $1.5 M reno), the room was OK - very large, but not laid out well.  Several stains on the carpet and with sinks located outside the bathroom, needed hooks for towels.  $15 parking fee was unnecessary as there were many open/vacant spots.

Very cute, clean, retro, beachy vibe hotel! Super comfortable and quiet room. Had a wine "happy hour" when we got there and after, milk and cookies and the cookies were amazing! Friendly nice staff and nicely decorated room. Walking distance to downtown. Definitely would stay here again!!!

Summary Heading: Friendly and nice place to stay in a Laguna Beach.
Summary: We had friendly staff that worked with us. Was esp nice since we had had a bad experience elsewhere at a high end resort. This offered pleasant rooms, friendly staff, evening wine, cookies and milk before bed and proximity to many restaurants, etc in Laguna Beach. Near the Beach as well. Will go back in the future.

We stayed for a night and wished we could stay longer!  This was a great little boutique spot, with a low key pool area and jacuzzi that we took advantage of during the afternoon and evening.  Short walk from the beach, galleries and restaurants.  We had excellent sushi a block away at 242 fusion sushi.  Staff was friendly and accommodating, rooms were clean, well maintained and had a casual beach vibe.  Free coffee in the morning and great books and mags to read if your other half is sleeping in :)   Highly recommend.

Stayed here one night on our way back to LA room was fine however although it had ocean view it also had an extremely noisy AC unit and road noise so sleep was something that was lacking. Disappointing end to our trip and felt that cost for one night at 250$ was high for what was on offer

At first, our room was located right next to the elevator. We can hear the elevator noise and people walking by. The front desk immediately changed the room for us and it was so much better.  Location was great, not far from all the restaurants and the beach.

Spent a miserable day and night at Balbia Bay Shores Inn and decided to bail out and find something simple quirky and fun... laguna beach house is it. Old style beach hotel with updates fun decor and great staff not to mention terrific location near beach sunsets and many restaurants.  We drive down guest 101 and felt the vibe in Dana point , San Juan Capistrano and Newport Beach... Laguna Beach was it.. feels like Venice beach a bit , without the hipsters.. good mix of young and old folks .. we will return!!

The Laguna Beach House was a great place to stay in a town with a great deal of art and surfing history. The facility is old, but updated enough to suit most travelers' tastes. The bed was comfortable and the room cleanliness and and service were top-notch. The other furniture was a bit dated but very functional. Its location is such that you can walk to most every place - beach walkways, multitude of restaurants, numerous art galleries, furniture stores, etc. Free parking is available under the building; an elevator is available; and complimentary refreshments and light snack are available in the morning.

This place was absolutely enjoyable. Very clean and guest services were terrific. Walking distance to the beach, shops, and restaurants. Very relaxing atmosphere. Definitely a future destination for us-from the east coast.

Summary Heading: Perfect Anniversary--THANK YOU LAGUNA BEACH HOUSE!!!
Summary: My husband and I chose the Laguna Beach House in great part to the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor--and we are so happy we did! The staff (Stephen, Troy, Peter and Annette) did everything imaginable to make our anniversary special. They were able to check us in a bit early to our gorgeous room (#208); lent us beach chairs, towels and an umbrella to take the short walk down to one of the most picturesque beaches in the world; had a lovely wine service in the late afternoon and fresh cookies at night! Staying here was very much like staying with friends who just so happen to have an awesome place at the beach--loved every second and cannot wait to return!

My husband and I had stayed our last night of our SoCal vacation at Laguna Beach House. It exceeded all expectations, the room was large and clean. We walked to local beaches and restaurants, didn't move our car once. The staff was amazing too! Our next time to socal will include more nights here!

Great hotel, adorable and charming!   We loved the:  Wine happy hour Cookies and milk at 8 The decorations in the lobby and room were unique and great!  (Beautiful sink it the bathroom) Loved the poolside fireplace for a relaxing evening Rooms are very clean and I appreciated the little things like the free face wipes and even the cute lights they had above the pool and in the parking garage :)    We will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Clean, cozy, comfortable, and relaxing stay at the Beach House
Summary: My wife and I enjoyed a relaxing stay at the Laguna Beach House. It was within our price range, and located close to the areas and places we wanted to visit. We literally parked when we arrived and walked everywhere during our stay. The building looks like an old motel, but it's been renovated nicely with a beachy, boho feel to it. We loved how clean everything was. I booked a King room with a balcony and the bed was spacious and super comfortable. The room had everything you needed and I enjoyed my coffee on the balcony in the morning. The front desk staff was very helpful and can help you with borrowing a beach umbrella, boogie board, and towels. The milk & cookies in the evening and yogurt and coffee in the morning are a nice touch.

Staff were helpful and friendly really nice rooms The hotel rooms were really clean, I have never stayed in such a clean room - top marks to Housekeeping! Only downside is the items that they have for sale in the rooms - you dont really know what you are able to touch!
Manager Response: Dear Susan S,  Thank you so much for staying with us. I do agree with you that our staff is the friendliest around. Our Housekeeping team does an excellent job with the rooms and they are proud of it each day. Thank you for the wonderful review and we look forward to your next visit!  Best Regards,  Steven K. Hotel Manager

Summary: We stayed just one night but were warmly welcomed and had great service. The room was small but very clean and well furnished. The private patio was probably not worth the extra money.  Enjoyed the free wine at 5:00 pm and the yogurt in the morning.  Good location made walking to the center of town easy.
Manager Response: Dear Iceh2o,  Thank you for choosing to stay here with us at The Laguna Beach House. We do get many compliments here for our wine hour and we hope to see you again at the property for the next time you choose to stay here. See you soon!  Best Regards,  Steven K. Hotel Manager

Summary: Return visit to the Beach House.  Our room happened to be ready so they graciously allowed us to check in early.  Rachel remembered a room preference from a past visit which was most impressive!  Room, lobby and pool area were sparkling clean.  Breakfast and coffee were dutifully put out earlier than advertised every day which is very cool as I am an early riser.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  All in all, a great value for the money.  We'll be back!
Manager Response: Dear VeevMc,  Thank you so much for returning back to our hotel. We do love it when our guests come back and see us as it gives us the chance to know one another. We pride ourselves in keeping our hotel clean and I am happy to hear that you noticed that. Thank you for the amazing review and we look forward to your next visit!  Best Regards,  Steven K. Hotel Manager

Summary: Fifties California Surf themed boutique inn with super friendly staff and chill guests give a really good vibe. Fun marketing of beach amenities in the room. Rooms are airy and tidy. The Inn is walking distance to the beach and the Laguna Beach scenic walkway. This place is also pet friendly.
Manager Response: Dear CanisLD,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review. We do love our decorations and most importantly, our guests love it too! I am glad to hear that you made good use of the areas around us as we are in walking distance to almost everything in town. We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel.  Best Regards,  Steven K. Hotel Manager

Summary: The hotel is not directly on the beach, but the location on Pacific Coast Highway is great.  My hubby and I only stayed one night and we wish we had stayed a week.  The staff is just wonderful.  The hotel is newly remodeled and super clean. We had room 216 on the corner (top floor of hotel) and it was perfect.  Everything about this place speaks to comfort...great toiletries, a super soft rug in the bathroom where the light turns on when you enter, comfortable robes, a mini 'fridge, a snack basket and drinks for purchase.  My hubby was not fond of the pillows yet they were fine to me.  The only negative that I can think of is that the shower floor was very slippery.  The best checkout time ever...12 noon.  We will return.
Manager Response: Dear JoInTexas,  Thank you so much for the lovely review! We're thrilled you found our staff to be wonderful and feel the same way about you. We hope next time you can visit for a week or more!  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: Enjoyed a WONDERFUL stay at this charming hotel with friends. Check in was smooth and friendly staff. Our room (208) was VERY spacious and well decorated! FABULOUSLY furnishings...perfect for a beach hotel! Comfy bed,  WC and tub conveniently separate from sink so 2 people could easily get ready at the same time. Corner room with view of the ocean. Although we didn't have an opportunity to use it, the pool area appeared very inviting! Complimentary coffee and yogurt parfait for breakfast was available in the lobby to start off our day.... greatly appreciated! We would DEFINITELY stay here again! EXCELLENT location...walking distance to shopping, restaurants and beach!
Manager Response: Dear Jill,  Thank you so much for this wonderful review! We truly appreciate it. Hope you can return to visit us again.  Warm regards,  Casey General Manager

Summary: We took the pleasure of staying here after a happy day at Disneyland, LOVED it! Large open room, really comfy beds, beautiful view, accommodating staff members. Would defiantly recommend staying here, and will be back😍

Such a great hotel and a hidden gem. The staff was amazing. Jason at the front desk went above and beyond making sure we had the best experience at their hotel. Rooms are adorable. Location is central. They have a wine hour everyday as well as milk and cookies.

I've stayed at the Laguna Riviera for nearly 40 years and their customer service seems to have disappeared completely so we were looking for a change of venue.  You would figure that they would want to retain guests that need little to no attention, but Susan at their front desk is always miserable.  Life is too short to deal with that attitude.    The front desk receptionist at the Laguna Beach House was very friendly.  They had wine available before dinner, cookies and milk available after dinner, and coffee in the morning.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  It wasn't located directly in front of a beach, so that was a downer.  Also, the patio had a view of the back parking lot, so that wasn't a typical beach stay.    I can't fault the hotel for their location not being

This is a great hotel within a pleasant walk from the beach.  The hotel has a great atmosphere and the staff and very friendly.  The complimentary coffee and yoghurt in the morning was a nice touch and enjoyed the wine in the evening.  Will definitely be returning to this hotel.

We LOVED our stay!  We arrived just before the wine happy hour in the lobby and were encourage to also try the happy hour at their sister location a couple blocks away.  Wine was replaced by cookies and milk a short time later - how fun!  Our ocean-side room was bright, clean and outfitted with all that's necessary - the usual and some unusual snacks and drinks, plus a beach bag and beach blanket.  Boogey boards are also available in the lobby.  The hotel is located right next to Heisler Park and it's beach trail - great for walking the beach, having picnics and seeing surfers and tide pools. The hotel staff were efficient, friendly, and a great resource for walking to restaurants and the Pageant of the Masters.  Choose this destination for affordable comfortable lodging close

Summary Heading: Shout out to Dennis at the front desk!!!
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here and highly recommend this hotel. The staff makes this place top notch. Dennis at the front desk was extremely helpful to us and gave us phenomenal service. The hotels renovations made this place a clean welcoming and fun environment. Hotel was within walking distance to all the fun restaurants in Laguna.

Summary Heading: Hotel's makeover makes it very special
Summary: Stayed here 4 years ago and thought it was a great hotel, arrived last week for a second visit to find it had benefited from an extensive beach-themed, make-over giving it a funky-but-luxurious feel.  Best bit, though, were the reception staff ... Annette, Jason and Peter couldn't do enough for you.  Really top-class professionals.

Stayed a couple of nights in August and impressed from the start. Arrived early but still checked in earlier than advertised. Room lovely, huge bed and the decor was so in keeping with the beach and surf. Clean, tidy with loads of storage, sad only to be staying 2 nights. Pool area really nice and usually quiet, loungers spaced out so not invading each other's space. Wine in lobby early evening a lovely touch as well as coffee etc in the morning. Parking garage also good as car in the shade the whole time. Would we go back? Definitely!!

I found this little gem quite by accident. The hotel I had reserved was less than desirable so as luck would have it, I literally walked in off the street and met Katie who saved me from having to sleep in my car.  The hotel itself is cozy and warm with free WiFi and covered parking, conveniently located right on the coast hwy,  a mere walking distance to downtown. The remodeled rooms are spacious, clean, with all the amenities, including a dinette set, plantation shutters, more than ample storage for your clothes and other items, beautiful modern decor, a very comfortable bed and even a wall mounted makeup mirror.  The staff is very friendly, pleasant and helpful, especially Katie, who went out of her way to accommodate.  Will definitely stay here again.

My daughter living in NY will be married next March in Laguna. She asked me to scout out several hotels for their guests. I was amazed at the little jewel just down the street from where I live!  The hotel is centrally located. You can walk everywhere. The rooms are comfortable and beautifully decorated. Many have private balconies. Best of all, the rates are very reasonable.  It's a perfect hotel for families down to the milk and cookies in the evening!

I was so pleased with our warm welcome when we arrived late from our long flight.  There was a card and gift for my fiancé when we entered our room.  And even though we didn't get a room with a balcony, we were actually happier with our room that had a couch, chairs, coffee table and full bathroom/vanity area.  Everything was in walking distance from the hotel and we were able to share wine hour with their sister hotel at The Inn at Laguna Beach.  The pool was warm and the everything was clean!  Highly recommend this charming paradise away from our charming home from the east Coast!  💖

This is a great family hotel. We stayed in a room on the pool level and it was very convenient with 2 kids. Location is awesome. 5min walk to ocean and Garden Cafe and Urth Cafe. Both great for b'fast & lunch. Easy 10min walk to downtown shops & restaurants.   Staff here is very friendly. Keep in mind this is not a true ocean front hotel. But rooms are very clean s d hotel is well kept

They sell online what is not the reality. It is like  the kind of motel like in leaving Las Vegas movie, totally a Lachapelle image. The rooms are located from one foot of a 2 square feet swimming pool full of kids and fat mamas tanning. Good luck.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay - amazing rooms
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights in July as part of our honeymoon and loved this place. It's quite a small hotel, great location on the edge of town but easy to walk to the main area, great rooms and set out nicely - loved the free wine in the early evening! Definitely recommend!

I stayed for 4 days and 3 nights at this lovely hotel and had a wonderful time!  My goal was to have a relaxing long weekend.  This goal was achieved by having a nice, clean room with a small balcony looking out at the ocean.  I have stayed at other Laguna Beach hotels; one hotel was so close to the ocean that I couldn't get a restful sleep due to the crashing of the waves.  But this hotel was further away from the surf and allowed me to sleep well.    I enjoyed the morning granola, the wine and cheese hour and the evening chocolate chip cookies.  For a nice lunch, I walked to the Urth Caffe, 1 1/2 blocks away.

Laguna Beach House is a short stroll into town and just a block off the beach. Stay here if you're looking for personal service. Rachel, the manager, goes so far above anything to offer advice, assistance, and book reservations for events and dinner. Trust her. She knows Laguna. The Beach House is low-key and the rooms are lovely. A great stay. Would definitely go back.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel walking distance to beach!
Summary: We were looking for a place to stay near the beach. Laguna Beach House hit the mark! You are closest to Heisler Beach which is a wonderful, less crowded beach. You are also just up the hill from Main Beach in Laguna. Main Beach is in the heart of town, more crowded, and more action. We were so pleased to "borrow" towels, umbrellas, and chairs from the hotel. There are only a certain amount so ask early! We could easily carry these items on the short walk to the beach.  We were visiting the LA/Orange County are with our two teenage daughters. This boutique hotel really lived up to our expectations! Parking, cookies, yogurt and granola, and wine offered each day!! The room was plenty big with our teenage daughters and there was plenty of storage to completely unpack! The bathroom

We had an amazing time in Laguna Beach and our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer.  The hotel was amazing - comfortable bed, large rooms, and we were really happy we splurged for a room with a view.  The front desk service was terrific and the coffee in the morning was a great way to begin each morning.  We will be back for sure!

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel close to beaches, several thoughtful extras were appreciated
Summary: We arrived tired from a long flight from the UK to a big smile and lovely fresh cookies. We were provided with a large room with two large double beds and a bathroom. Parking was simple but charged for (this was expected as it was clear on the website). The room was clean and had everything we needed and more. The pool is quite small but was never busy so was fine for us as a young family.. The fire pit looked cosy. There are 3-4 beaches within a few minutes walk of the hotel. They are a mixture of sandy coves with rock pools and wide sandy beaches. The hotel lent us buckets and spades and a belly board to take to the beach and even allowed us to take their towels! There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are a few restaurants and cafes within 5 minutes walk and the whole

Stayed here for one night with my 11 year old son. We had the private King room. It was perfect! The staff is SOOO friendly and accommodating! The hotel feels like a very quaint boutique style hotel. Very beach cottage feel. Pool deck was nice (NEEDED MORE POOL TOWELS). My son got to take/rent a boogey board out ti the beach - Complimentary! Also complimentary towels for the beach. Nice wine hour.Cookies and milk for my son (AND ME)!! They allowed me to stayed parked in their lot on check out day, so we could enjoy our day before we headed home. We were able to use the pool after we checked out. Staff was friendly ALL SMILES! We had arrived a bit early prior to "Official" check-in time. And since our room was ready, we checked -in and made our way to our room to get to go the

Our family of four (kids aged 10 and 12) had a very pleasant stay at Laguna Beach House. The room was so nice! Clean and neatly furnished with big comfortable beds. Friendly and helpful staff and a nice little pool area with lots of sunbeds and free towels.

Location is ideal..Rooms are larger than an average hotel room...comfortable...generous amenities....Complimentary wine happy hour, cookies for kids, morning coffee and yogurt, towels, umbrellas, beach chairs.  Pool area is charming with plenty of chairs, fire pit and spa open till 11pm.  We utilized the pool later in the day after the beach and spa after dinner.  The beach is so close.  A additional bonus was using the amenities at the Inn at Laguna Beach, located at Main Beach, which is a sister hotel to Laguna Beach House.  Ask for Katie, as she will tell you everything you need to know about Laguna and the property.  She was truly a great host.   We visited Laguna for a mom and teenage daughter vacation, 4people.  We were nervous about the room being cramped, but was

Summary Heading: Next Time I'll Go When School Is In
Summary: Great room. Great location. Staff was very friendly. I loved the surf books laying around the lobby & the room. Considering the price, everything came as advertised. Only problem was that the pool, the fire pit & the hot tub were infested with children staring at their smartphones from the time we checked in to when they "closed." On a weeknight. Can't fault the hotel for that, but I'll try again when school is back in.

LBH is perfect - situated a short walking distance from the main downtown area of Laguna Beach (including great restaurants and shopping) as well as beautiful beaches. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are pretty, very clean and spacious! With the open design of the hotel it can be a bit loud during the day but always quiet at nighttime. Will be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Beautiful retro surf hotel close to everything
Summary: Loved this hotel  beautiful big rooms next to the pool and hot tub. Free beach towels and umbrellas. Free yoghurt and granola in the morning. Free coffee and tea. Massive beds with good wifi and tv. Only 10 mins walk to centre of town full of restaurants and bars and hip shops.would return tomorrow

My husband and I just returned from Laguna Beach for a short getaway for our anniversary. I could not be happier with his hotel choice! From the moment we arrived, every staff member was so helpful and genuinely nice. One of the perks is that they have a complimentary wine hour in the evening with delicious California wine, and for a couple hours later in the evening they have (yummy) cookies and milk available that are made fresh daily in the sister facility down the street. The location could not be better, as it is close enough to the main beach to walk, but far away enough that it is a bit more laid back. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. We plan on taking some travel nursing assignments in California in the future, and definitely plan on a return visit to

My wife and I recently stayed at the Laguna Beach house for our wedding anniversary. We could not have been more impressed with the attention to detail, customer service, and helpful demeanor of the entire staff. The location is the absolute definition of IDEAL - a three minute walk to Heisler Park and less than ten minutes to the main beach and all of the shopping one would wish for. A dedicated parking garage underneath the hotel grounds is extremely convenient for coming and going. Rooms were very nicely furnished and clean. We really enjoyed the fact that the hotel is making conscious efforts to "go green" with many of their practices geared towards an eco-friendly movement. The pool and spa area is a smaller, intimate style setting which gives it a nice "mom and pop" feel

Our family of four loved staying here for a week. It's within walking distance to the beach and to shops and eateries in downtown Laguna. Mostly, it's the clean and recently updated rooms, plus the small touches like free coffee and yogurt in the morning and free wine, as well as milk and chocolate chip cookies in the evening, that make Laguna Beach House special!  We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

We arrived June 28 and are staying until July 3.  The staff, is incredible and could not be more helpful, always asking if there is anything they can do and if there is anything you need.  The rooms are clean, great beds, decorated really nicely and the grounds and pool are so clean.  They have completely refurbished this hotel, it is also owned by the  Inn at Laguna Beach, which I have also stayed and is fantastic, as well. Both hotels are in great locations, on the water side and 2 blocks from town. I would highly recommend both hotels.  The Laguna Beach House, only has 36 rooms so it's not too big.  Wine, at night and Coffee and yogurt, in the morning. I will definitely come back. Judie Berendt

We stayed here for one night.  The room was exactly what we expected, clean and cute.  The pool and hot tub were also nice.  The location was really perfect.  We walked to dinner, to get drinks, Starbucks, and the beach.

The hotel was wonderful, small, chic and welcoming. Upon check in I was offered cookies and milk to be enjoyed by the fire which was a great perk after a long flight from NYC. The property reminded me a lot of the Surf Lodge in Montauk which was wonderful. The rooms were very spacious, I had a great balcony to overlook the Ocean and Pool views. The room was clean and comfortable, it has all the things of a high end luxury hotel with the feel of a surfer retreat, so laid-back, cool but not pretentious at all.

Summary Heading: Laid back 70s CA vibe that is immaculate with GREAT customer service!
Summary: Where to begin? Annette, Katie, Rachel, Jason, Peter, and the WHOLE GANG go above and beyond on even the most minute inquiry. Dennis is a walking history book of Laguna! It was as fun visiting the lobby as it was the beach, the pool, or the fab fire pit! The room was super cool, but I was rarely in it! There is so much to do (all relaxing and restorative) that the room was simply a place to clean up and sleep. Don't miss this gem! the owner does and OUTSTANDING JOB picking out the music (that is almost on mute and plays as a great background to add to the vibe) that sets the tone for the guests. Thank you, Laguna Beach House, for making my first trip to the West Coast a pleasure and a great experience! I WILL BE BACK!

Summary Heading: More of a motel than hotel
Summary: Enjoyed our 2 nights here. Rooms recently renovated and clean. Pool is adequate in size. The music is set at a comfortable level for reading or talking. It is only 2 floors with an elevator. There isn't much of an ocean view as other buildings block that, but a short walk takes you to Laguna Cliffs area, which is very nice to look at but not for swimming. They offer a happy hour of wine at 5pm, and cookies and milk after that. I would rather see an offer of an ice-cream bar, including a root-bear float, which all guests could partake of, and would be cost-effective for them as opposed to cost of alcohol. Staff was excellent. It is about a 10-minute walk to the main area of the beach park, where most of the restaurants are located. Since parking is hard to find, we walked it

We could not be any happier with our stay.  We had room 107 which is a poolside double queen room.  A small balcony off of the back had a view of water to my right and the beautiful homes in the hills to my left.  A small enclave of homes were below.  Directly outside our door was a table/umbrella and four chairs.  We were able to sit outside at night and enjoy the fire pit and conversation but still had our privacy. The room design was relaxing and very fresh.  In fact the complete property is designed for a beach vacation.  Parking is very convenient.  We walked both nights into downtown to have dinner and enjoy some evening shopping.  A simple walk around the corner and your in beautiful Heisler Park!  Wonderful beaches and fantastic scenery.  Don't miss the tide pools in the

I spent 6 days here with my daughter and toddler granddaughter. The standout amenities for me were the comfortable bed and my evenings relaxing at the fire pit by the pool. I met some interesting people from all parts of the world to converse with. The hotel is conveniently located a short distance to the walking trail in Heisler Park along the bluff. We had a view of the ocean in the distance from our second story room.The walk to shops and restaurants was convenient. Another daughter who lives in a nearby town was able to park during the day time in the hotel garage without an extra charge and join us for swimming, beach walks, and eating out. Breakfast was really just a small serving of greek yogurt and granola, but it served its purpose of warding off hunger pangs until we

Having spent some $3000 to stay at this hotel we were most surprised at their unhelpful attitude at the end of our stay. They were  incapable of providing any sort of facility for us to shower and freshen up before our 5pm pick up for the 15 hour flight home. The best they would offer was a 30 minute extension to our check out time to 12:30. Steaming hot weather all day and they said we could use the pool but couldn't offer a shower or somewhere to change afterwards!!

This was a well-equipped boutique hotel one block away from the beach and very close to lots of good shopping and restaurants.  The staff was super helpful and accommodating, especially Peter who was always chipper and enthusiastic and happy to help.  Everything was very clean and our room was surprisingly well-sized for this smallish hotel. Although it is not waterfront, the beach is really close and the views are breathtaking. We had a back lanai with a peekaboo view of the ocean but to the left was a main road so it wasn't an area we felt like relaxing in.  We much preferred just to walk to the beach and have the full view.  The bed was very comfortable and new although a little too soft for my taste (not enough back support).  The bath vanity sink area was very pretty and

This is such a cool hotel.  The rooms are fantastic, plenty of space and lots of storage so you can unpack properly.  Shuttered windows, big beds, quiet and relaxing and a short walk to the centre of town and main beach.  they don't charge you to park!  Staff are really friendly and very helpful.  Great value.  Would love to stay again.

Summary Heading: Excellent property, with great views and service!
Summary: This is a treasure close to the heart of Laguna Beach's main beach. The staff is warm, friendly and accommodating. The rooms are super cute, clean, the beds are cozy. I love the vibe of the hotel and the pool and jacuzzi are great!

Me and my girl spent 3 days at LBH.  4 star rating is no knock on the property versus 5 star.  I'd say top rating I'd give a small motel.  Check in was friendly and efficient.  Rooms had a beach vibe. Recently reno'd, clean and bright.  Website is a good representation of what you will get.  Rooms nice and comfortable.  Pool is not huge, but plenty big for a nice cool down dip.  Pool area nice scale to size at this small motel.  The level of insight staff had about the area was mixed.  Some offered a lot of recommendations, others were not as familiar. That said, all were polite and courteous.  From the pool area there is a view of the ocean.  Not panoramic view, but you can see the ocean.  A five minute walk around the block and you are at the ocean side Heisler park.  A

Hubby and I got away for our anniversary and had a great time here! Room was so cute and we had a great view of the ocean! Loved all of the little touches they had available to us and how accommodating the staff was! Will definitely come back!

My partner & I came here for just a few nights for a small vacation. Because of the price & amenities, it was our first choice. We expected it not to be extremely high quality, like a resort hotel, but it ended up being so much more than we expected! It was spotless, had plenty of space for two people, the fridge was enough to hold extra drinks and small food items, and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was perfectly welcoming and helpful with our questions, and we had absolutely no issues. There weren't very many other guests so we had plenty of privacy & there was minimal to no noise at any time of the day. The pool is small but great for a short dip & the jacuzzi was big enough for quite a few people. It's not very exciting for kids, but for a young couple that was

My daughter and I were booked here for two nights, but had to cancel the second night.  We got in at night and had to check out the next morning, so we didn't get a chance to stay long.  The room was clean and nicely decorated.  The beds were comfortable as well.  The man checking us in was very nice and professional. He even let us borrow his umbrella when we went out in the rain for a drink. We had a quiet night's sleep, and enjoyed the yogurt, granola and coffee in the morning before checking out.   All in all, a good stay, and like I said, I wish we could have stayed longer. Great location.

Came for a one night getaway and were very pleased! The wine hour, the cookies and milk, the breakfast, all were unbelievable. I would recommend this place to anyone. The area is beautiful, the staff is nice, the jacuzzi/fire pit are open til 11, I can go on and on. Just wonderful. Oh, and the mini bar! Cmon! So good!

Great hotel!  Clean, walking distance to everything, so hip!  Wine hour? Yup.  Cookies and milk hour?  Hell yeah!  Towels and chairs for the beach? Yup!  Great staff? Yup!  Maids on top of cleaning? Yup!  Saw whales from my bedroom window? Yup, heck, I could HEAR them! Stay here, you won't regret it!!

This place was fantastic, nice quiet location right by the beach. Staff was very friendly, room was clean and comfortable. Perfect location to walk to get food or head to the beach. I' happy I found this hidden gem in Laguna, I would love to stay again!

Although I recognize that Laguna Beach is a destination city, I fail to understand why an at best average hotel thinks it is ok to charge you $375 a night.  The good - I agree the decor is nicely done.  Throw back 1960s surf culture feels trendy and hip.  Bed was comfortable with lots of pillows.  Shower was hot.  Staff was friendly.  Room was a nice size.    The bad - "steps to the beach" really means walking around the block to the park, then across the park to the stairs, then down to the beach.  The room we stayed in was literally 20 feet away from Pacific Coast Highway and was too noisy to get a good night's sleep.  There were no open rooms to move to.  I had to clean most of the surfaces when we arrived and I am not a neat freak.  A couple of the pillowcases and the sheets

Summary Heading: Kinda cute but street noise and overpriced
Summary: Website is sleek, hotel is less so. Fun decor, but it's still a motel. Staff was extremely welcoming and efficient. Room was adjacent to PCH, so very noisy. Initial impression of room was it's light and bright, but something greasy streaked on glass top table and some black (mascara?) stain on a pillow case. We cleaned the table and removed that pillow. Bed was comfy, lots of pillows, so no lasting problems. Did not use the pool/jacuzzi. 10 min walk to Main Beach, but the walk is lovely along Heisler Park with view of ocean. Resort fee covers breakfast yogurt and granola, which we don't eat, and wine at 5pm and cookies at 6pm. I would prefer to skip the fee and forego these offereings, but if you happen to be at the hotel at that time, it's a small nicety. I have mixed feelings

I would stay over and over! Service is great, close to beach and walking distance  to everything. I stayed for week and really was able to enjoy it! I feel rested and ready to go back to NYC! I would recommend this hotel to my friends to stay!
Manager Response: Dear OscarVela:  Thank you for your great response!  We always love to hear that our guests would come back to stay with us because of our great service and location.  Please do not hesitate to contact me when you are ready for another break from the Big Apple.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: Really cool looking place. Great decorations. Friendly staff. Super close to the beach and give you chairs and towels and beach diversions (ie. paddle rackets). It's a great place to stay and the rooms were spacious and clean.
Manager Response: Dear Joanna P:  Thank you for taking the time to share your "Great stay" on TripAdvisor.  We always love to hear when we are doing things right.  I am also happy to hear that you took full advantage of our Beach Amenities.  We have recently added a few Smash Ball games to our beach amenities for our guests to enjoy.  Joanna P, thank you for such a great review.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary Heading: The Beach House has it's groove back!
Summary: Visited The Beach House earlier this month.  Been there 17-20 times over the past 20 years.  People, especially Rachel, were friendly and helpful. Got there early to drop our bags and knew a room wouldn't be ready.  Rachel called a couple hours later, still prior to normal check in time, when the room was ready and bags were already in the room.  Coffee and yogurt were out early for breakfast. Room, pool and lobby were spotless.   Loved it!
Manager Response: Dear VeevMc:  It is wonderful to hear that you recognized that we got groove back!  The renovation that we completed last year definitely provided that retro surfer vibe throughout our lobby and guest rooms.  I also want to thank you for mentioning me as well.  It is because of wonderful guests like you I enjoy coming to work.  VeevMc, we cannot wait to host you again in the future.  Please contact me directly when you are ready to come back.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: We have family in Orange County so we booked this room. We are so glad we did! Everything was true to the description and the staff was amazing!!  The room was clean and comfortable. The location was amazing! We definitely recommend it and would go back again!!
Manager Response: Dear Rene P:  Thank you for choosing to stay with us while visiting your family in Orange County!  We know that Laguna Beach has so many wonderful options and were thrilled that you fell in love with us.
