Rene P, feel free to contact me directly when you are planning your next trip to Laguna Beach.  I would be happy to assist you with any of your reservation needs.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary Heading: Perfect location for a long weekend getaway
Summary: Laguna Beach House offered everything we were looking for: clean and bright rooms, crisp bed linens, easy access to the boardwalk/beach and walking distance to local restaurants. Guests were a mix of couples (young and old) and families; although it is situated next to the highway, we were not disturbed by traffic noise at all.  There were some nice little touches, including a complementary glass of wine each evening and granola/yoghurt and coffee at breakfast (though you'll still need to buy breakfast elsewhere if, like me you have a big appetite!).  The pool area gets the sun during the day and you can warm up by the fire pit after sunset too.  The pool is small, so only really suitable to cool off in, rather than for doing any real laps.  We really enjoyed our stay and will
Manager Response: Dear BrynDHughes:  Thank you for your perfect review on our Beach House!  It was great to hear that we offered everything that you were looking for.  The Beach House is the perfect location for the young and young at heart.  Many of our amenities, such as our nightly wine reception and fire pit, are perfect for couples enjoying a romantic getaway.  We even offer cookies and milk for the children to enjoy.  If you are heading to the beach don't forget to stop by for your beach amenities (towels, chairs, umbrellas, and sand toys).  BrynDHughes, please do not hesitate to contact me directly when you decided to return to Laguna Beach.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary Heading: Fantastic location - service/ammenties below expectations for price
Summary: You can't beat the location for staying in Laguna Beach - we parked our car at the hotel and were able to walk everywhere, which was a big plus, as was having Heisler Park right around the corner. For the price, however, we were disappointed in the quality of the remodeled rooms and the service. We stayed for three nights, and each morning while housekeeping was prompt, we were missing 1-2 items from our rooms (washcloths, coffee cups, etc.) and had to make repeated trips to the front desk for supplies. Additionally, the bath tub was pretty beat up/cracked and the toilet was difficult to flush. Other than these admittedly minor things, this was a clean, beautiful place to stay - but as mentioned above we expected a bit more for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Teebs:  Thank you for taking the time to share your fair opinion about our Beach House.  Please know that I will be addressing the issues that you mentioned above so that the next time you visit us you will think of us as being a fantastic place.  Teebs, please keep us in mind if you decide to venture back to Laguna Beach.  I would love to handle your reservations personally to ensure that you have an excellent stay.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: We chose to spend one night in Laguna Beach on our family trip to CA, and what an amazing choice we made staying in The Laguna Beach House.  The hotel staff were so pleasant, the rooms were absolutely adorable, very clean and fresh, a flash back to a surf scene in the 60s. The decor was so cute!  The hotel was close to everything, a quick walk to Heisler Park, downtown and main beach.  Could not have chosen a better place, we plan to return!  Firepit was an extra bonus watching the amazing post sunset sky from the pool.  The only recommendation would be adding more to your breakfast, other than that A+!
Manager Response: Dear elledgefam4:  Thank you for your "A+" review on our Beach House! I could not agree with you more about our fire pit. I feel that after a long day of exploring the fire pit is the perfect place to unwind and relax.  Elledgefam4, if you and your family make your way back to Laguna Beach please do not hesitate to contact me.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel

Summary: Upon arriving for our two night stay, we were greeted by super friendly staff who helped us check in (early!).  We stayed in room 202.  It was a nice, renovated room with new furnishings.  Loved the bright white, beach theme.  Only complaint was room was a little hot and didn't cool down enough but that was very minor.  The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful.  The parking was super convenient and the pool was heated.  Five minute walk to beach and walking distance to all restaurants and shops.  Highly recommended!
Manager Response: DancerGirl40:  Thank you for your kind words about our friendly staff and rooms.  I am sorry that the room was not cool enough for you and we will make sure to check the a/c unit for future guests.    The Laguna Beach House is a short distance to the downtown area and some of our favorite coves.  I hope that you were able to enjoy all that Laguna Beach has to offer.    DancerGirl40, please do not hesitate to contact me directly when you decide to return.  Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary: This is a quality hotel.  We enjoyed the cleanliness, friendliness, quiet, and location.  Staff was helpful knowledgeable.  The room had  a nice view and no disturbing noise from  other rooms. It is close to town and there are good restaurants close by.  Amenities are well maintained.
Manager Response: Dear S5599CJjamem:  Thank you for letting us know about your pleasant stay.  You highlighted some of our many exceptional qualities such as our cleanliness of hotel and knowledgeable staff.    We hope to see you back at the Beach House in the near future.  Rachel T

Summary: When we arrived we were quickly checked in and got very excited when we saw our room.  Ask for 216!  It is on a corner with windows on both sides featuring views of the ocean and pool/property.  The bed and pillows were sooo comfy.  Complimentary wine, cookies and yogurt parfait made our stay for our 36th Anniversary a perfect getaway!  They even had a card for us with a box of sea salt caramels that were exquisite.  We will definitely return and recommend to our family and friends.  Behind the hotel is a gorgeous walk along the ocean cliffs and the beach is a block away.  Great restaurants within walking distance!

We stayed at the Laguna Beach House for five days in March and every day was perfect. The room was spacious, cool and very California beachy. And the bed was incredibly comfortable. The staff was great and the amenities like happy hour (including on the terrace at their sister property), and cookies and milk in the evening were fantastic. Can't wait to go back.
Manager Response: Dear beachtravelers996:  It is great to hear that you felt that we were a great escape!  Our nightly wine reception and cookies and milk are the perfect way to wind down after a day at the beach.  I was also happy to hear that you stopped by our sister property, The Inn at Laguna Beach, to enjoy happy hour and amazing views.  It is the perfect place to enjoy a cocktail with one of the best views in town.  Beachtravelers996, please do not hesitate to contact me directly when you are ready to escape again.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel

Summary Heading: Honestly it depends how much you pay
Summary: We visited the Laguna Beach House in March 2016. Most of what the other reviewers have said is true: the staff is nice; the rooms are big and the hotel is very well decorated. However we paid close to 350$ a night if you include the pool side room; parking and the resort fee. For close to that price; there were ocean view rooms at the surf and sand (4star resort) or Laguna's Inn. Lbh is not worth that price; at most they should be charging 200/250$ a night. Also the 10$ resort fee is a joke; this hotel is absolutely not a resort; it's a well decorated motel and they should absolutely not be charging a resort fee
Manager Response: Dear isabellap1984:  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience.  We value all observations made by our guests and take them in consideration.  I would also like to thank you for commenting on our nice staff and well decorated hotel.  I am sorry that you did not feel that our Resort Fee was justified.  This fee includes  several services such as: Wi-Fi, Beach Amenities, Nightly Wine Reception, Nightly Cookies and Milk, and a morning offering of coffee, tea and a yogurt parfait.  Isabellap1984, if you decide you would like to give us another try please do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel

Summary: Stayed here for one night as part of West Coast road trip. This hotel was amazing. Staff, room and service all excellent. Room was so quaint, uniquely furnished and well equipped. The pool area was super clean and added bonus of a hot tub. Staff very obliging and gave us great recommendations for restaurant options. If going to Laguna Beach, could not recommend this place any more.

Staff is extremely professional, friendly, and helpful. The hotel is very comfortable and two minutes walking distance from the beach. Laguna Beach House is the perfect hotel for someone looking to relax and quickly walk to the beach. Free wine from 5 to 6!! We will definitely always stay here when we visit Laguna Beach.

Let me tell you why we fell in love with Laguna Beach House (LBH) and why we've decided to make LBH an annual winter escape from the frozen prairie.  LOCATION-The very center of town at Pacific Coast Hwy and Broadway is a noisy free-for-all at all hours.  Along the highway to the north and south, properties not on the beach side still get all of the traffic noise and less (if any) of the view.  LBH is just north of the epicenter, in very easy walking distance of the shops, restaurants, galleries and best beaches along the very best stretch of the beautiful surfside boardwalk, and just enough removed from the center of town to be much, much quieter.  Very few hotels are directly on the beach; LBH is a block off the beach and we felt it was hands-down the best location among the

Summary Heading: Laguna Beach House - A great place to stay when in Laguna Beach
Summary: I have stayed at the Laguna Beach House two times now and will look to stay there when I visit the area again.   The staff is very welcoming and friendly.  They go out of their way to make sure you have a great stay.  The rooms are nice and clean and well appointed. It is place you would to stay if you are visiting the Beach.  There is an evening happy hour where wine is served and also a nice night cap with fresh baked cookies and milk.  You are literally walking distance from Laguna Beach, many of Laguna Beach's nice bars and restaurants.  The price is very reasonable considering location and the amenities.    I would recommend anyone who is coming to Laguna Beach to consider the Laguna Beach House.   I know I will.

Summary Heading: Great couple of days at Laguna Beach
Summary: This hotel was as good, or even better as the reviews I read before making the reservation.  Location is fantastic, room was spacious, very nicely decorated, and excellent service.  We stayed for two nights and had never been to Laguna Beach.  Would love to stay there again.  Can't really think of a better place to stay.

Stayed here only one night with my girlfriend but wish we could have stayed longer.  Staff is very friendly and loved the beach decor.  Amazing views from the rooms.  Prices are very affordable and make this place a great value.  Free parking was awesome.  They also have a sister property a couple blocks away that offered a free wine happy hour which was great.  Only complaints would be the wifi was spotty in our room and the hot tub cleanliness was suspect.  Otherwise great experience and would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Austin P:  Thank you for taking the time to share with us your experience at the Beach House.  One of the great things about booking at the Beach House is you are able to experience some of the services at our sister property, The Inn at Laguna Beach.  Right now our guests are able to experience the wine reception, daily bar service, and coming soon - Beach Valet (Memorial Day Weekend through Labor Day).  Austin, if you need to get away to the Beach do not hesitate to contact me.  Regards,  Rachel

Summary: What a great little place.  Staff was very friendly, great location with weekend trolley to downtown Laguna.  While not "on" the beach it is a short walk away and the hotel is very welcoming.  who can forget the milk and cookies!?
Manager Response: danielcT1902ZN:  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Beach House.  I was pleased to read that you enjoyed our amenities, location, and friendly staff.  I would also like to mention that along with the cookies we have a nightly wine reception for our hotel guests and a morning offering of coffee, tea, and yogurt parfait.    danielcT1902ZN, please don't hesitate to contact me directly when you decide to return to the Beach House.  I will also make sure you get a few cookies placed in your room.  Regards,  Rachel

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Laguna Beach House for 3 nights and loved this little gem!  We loved everything about the hotel, it is a cute unique hotel with the surfer beach house feel.  The decorations are lovely.  The room was amazing with great views from our balcony.  Less than 5 min walk to the beach.  We also walked to different restaurants, bars and shopping during our stay.  Perfect hotel in a great location and would definitely stay there again!!
Manager Response: Dear 451breanss:  Thank you for your kind words on our little gem!  You have mentioned so many of our wonderful attributes such as the surfer design and great location that we can't wait for you to return.    While the Beach House is not in the heart of the downtown area it is a short walk to some of our favorite restaurants and shops.  We highly recommend Urth Cafe to start your morning.  451breanss, thank you again for taking the time to share your stay with us.  When you decide to visit again please do not hesitate to contact me directly.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel

Summary: This was my second visit to Laguna Beach House and both visits were better than expected.  Laguna Beach House is a great hotel with friendly, capable staff.  Access to the beach is a mere three minute walk from the lobby door and is within a few blocks from the boardwalk, fine dining and really nice art galleries.
Manager Response: Dear dansN8814SX,  Thank you for taking the time to share with us your recent experience at the Beach House.  It is also great to hear that both visits were better than expected.  You also mentioned one of my favorite reason why I love coming to work - the staff.  They work hard to provide a memorable experience for our guests and it shows.  Thank you again, dansN8814SX.  We hope that we will continue to exceed your expectations every time you visit us.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel

Summary: This a fun, quirky place to stay in Laguna. The surf theme is exceptionally well-executed, and it will really get you in the beach mindset. The lobby is nice, though small, and the decorations are a lot to take in. The service was friendly. The rooms themselves are large and true to the theme. There are fun items for purchase in the rooms too (I'd have bought the cute beach tote if I didn't already have so many). The mini bar is exceptionally well appointed, and reasonably priced (for a mini bar).   The bathroom was large, and the sink was super cool. My only qualm is that the furnishings in the bathroom could have been a little nicer, and the sink area is open to the room. I might have preferred they close off the entire bathroom space, and include a glass enclosed shower, but

Summary Heading: Fast & Loose With Descriptions On Website
Summary: We did really like it here, BUT it wasn't at all like advertised. First of all there was NO ocean view even though I paid for ocean view room. We were told on check in that only the balcony rooms had a view.   As well the owner or manager reprimanded us for showing up before 4 PM. We didn't care or need to check in early, we just stopped by to see if there was a room at 12:45, he yelled at us and made us feel terrible. The gal working the front desk was amazing, though, and she got us checked in early, but we didn't need to. We do know that check is at most hotels is at 4, we didn't need to be told that by the guy working. He was awful.   That said, she checked us in, the room was fine, nice, clean, etc. but had no view, that was disappointing. Also, when I called I specifically

Summary Heading: Great stay, quirky place and so friendly
Summary: Really lovely quirky place to stay. We only stayed a night and once there didn't have to use our car at all. Lovely surroundings and lovely little rooms round the pool with everything you could need. Kate the lady who we checked in with was brilliant, very helpful and friendly. Not even a minute walk to the beach and such a beautiful setting.

Cleanliness, delightfully appointed, wonderful staff, comfort and location make this wonderful little hotel the perfect place to stay when visiting Laguna Beach.  From my first conversation when making our reservation to check in to check out, the staff  treated us like every staff in every hotel should treat their guests.  Check in was a breeze and for the first time in a long time, we didn't have to wait until that 4:00 p.m. check in time every hotel advertises.  It was nice to get into our room with still plenty of time to visit shops and galleries before they closed.  We were greeted less than an hour after check in by the manager bearing a bottle of wine and cookies for my husband's birthday.  Wonderful surprise.   The room was decorated in a beach design which was so

My wife and I stayed for two nights in this quaint little surfer chic motel. It's been recently renovated and is extremely clean inside and out. We stayed in room 201 on the second floor and had a nice ocean view. Most rooms on the 2nd floor have at least a partial view of the ocean so it's not a real big deal. The rooms on the first floor all seem to surround the pool, which is major plus for this hotel. Everything outside once again is immaculate. There's a nice hot tub that's always running and a fire pit that's turned on at about 5 o'clock when the hotel has its free wine hour. For the wine are you can also walk two blocks down the street to the Inn at Laguna Beach which is the sister property. That location is larger and much more expensive but right on the ocean and has

Nice small pool and jacuzzi.  Rooms are nice though the sink drained very slowly and the heating and cooling did not work 100%.  It is decently located with parking and only a few hundred yards from the main drag, though it is steeply uphill for the way home - which was nice for us.

What a fun, funky, great place!  An excellent renovation of an old motel like structure.  Just loved it!  Wanted to stay longer ~  Nice breakfast, super clean room, awesome pool and hot tub, and a fire pit to keep you warm on a cool CA night !

Summary Heading: Quaint Hotel Close to Beach & Shopping
Summary: A friend & I met here for a get together. After reading & re-reading reviews of several hotels, & not wanting to spend $400 a night, I chose Laguna Beach House.   It's a very quaint hotel in which I was greeted by the desk clerk who gave me all of the information I needed to know about the hotel as well as recommending some places for dinner. The hotel has a surf theme, so their decor & some of their reading material is all about surfing. The hotel has wine in the evenings, as well as milk & cookies.   The room was clean & definitely had a "beach" feel. Loved the way the bathroom was set up - sink & counter in one area & toilet & shower in another. That way, if one person is showering or using the restroom, another can still use the sink & mirror (for putting on make-up).   The

My wife and I recently spent a night in this small but lovely hotel.  The room was very clean and had a little balcony to see the ocean.  Great staff and super location to walk into town especially on the ocean sidewalk path.  They offer overnight parking for a fee but it is well worth the price.  They also provide wine, cookies and a morning coffee bar and yogurt.  The price for our one night was very reasonable so if we return to LB we will stay at the LB House.

From the huge framed California flag in the lobby to the strings of lights over the parking area, this recently remodeled hotel really captures the OC beach vibe.  Super comfortable bed with a surfboard over it-  wine at 5- short walk to the beach and downtown-  plus they take dogs without an extra charge.   Super friendly staff.

Beautifully decorated room that was extremely clean, a little view of the ocean, perfect location short walk downtown, friendly staff, loved the cookies at night and yogurt and granola in the morning. Only thing I wish parking and resort fee were included in the price, with both its an extra $25 dollars. Not a big deal but I would just include it so no surprises for guests. Otherwise wonderful place to stay, you all are doing a great job!

Summary Heading: Great Location & Away From The Crowds
Summary: Just north of the 133 on PCH just past La Brisas above Heisler Park. Rooms have been renovated in a surf/beachy motif.  Rooms are great, nice pool & hot jacuzzi. Wine hour at 5, cookie & coffee at 6 and a nice morning coffee bar and yogurt.   You can walk to the main park of Laguna by the basktball courts in no time or town if you want to grab a bite or do some shopping.  Underground parking ($15) which is great and worth it. Ocean view from the 2nd floor rooms. Overall a small but great boutique place with a great & helpful staff. Recommend.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and perfect spot to get away!
Summary: I think this is a somewhat hidden gem. It's priced very well,  the service is outstanding, and the rooms are quiet, clean and uber comfortable. All done in a non-pretentious beachy feel. Ask for a coastal king balcony room - you'll see why. Would definitely recommend - I feel like I've been at a spa for 3 days!!

My boyfriend and I live in Los Angeles, and are constantly trying out different hotels for weekend getaways. I must say, I'm so sad we didn't discover this one earlier! It's now going to be our go-to place. Amazing branding and decor, heated pool and hot-tub, comfortable bed, nice size room, well maintained, and super friendly staff. Can't beat it for the price. So glad we found this place.
Manager Response: Dear Activemommy:  I am absolutely delighted that you found us!  The hotel was renovated last year and the surf theme was infused throughout the décor of the property.  I love the surfboards hanging over our beds and our beautifully framed California Republic flag.    Activemommy, don't hesitate to contact me when you are ready to come back to Laguna Beach.  I would love to say hello!  Regards, Rachel

Summary: My husband and I spent one night at the Laguna Beach House.  It is a surfing themed hotel.  the rooms are spacious, modern and clean. the bed was very comfortable and we really enjoyed the toiletries.  In the room there were snacks and beverages available for purchase.  the pool area was very nice.  In addition to the pool there was also a hot tub and fire pit. I would love to stay here again

My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night in October. We both loved it, we wished we could have stayed longer. The hotel is a small, laid back, friendly place. Service was great. The nice, young man who checked us in even offered to make us dinner reservations at a local restaurant.   The rooms have a beachy, surfer vibe… Very cool. We had a pool view room with a peek-a-boo view of the ocean. The rooms are a bit small, but who cares, you’re only there to sleep anyways. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from all the action, which was cool because we got to explore :)  They do have a parking garage and there is a fee.   We would definitely stay here again! :)

My boyfriend and I were there for three nights on our California-Trip and we wished we could stay longer;-). It is a small, very friendly and relaxing Hotel, our room had a small balcony with a side see-view, great (could be a bit loud, but the highway no.1 is everywhere next to the beach there...). The whole decoration reminds you on vacation, surfing, see, it is a mix of modern and cozy.  Even there is no kitchen, so no breakfast, you can get some coffee in the morning and yoghurt with cereals, perfect. In the afternoon they had a wine-tasting hours, so we could seat with our glas of wine next to the fire place, very romantic and relaxing.  The pool is too small for "real" swimming, for refreshing and kids it is ok, but you have the beach next to your door:-), ca. 5 min. to

Summary Heading: Great, low key, lovely remodeled Highway 1 lodging in Laguna Beach.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here in October 2015 with our 6 year old.  A remodeled 1950s/1960 motel-esque hotel that has been thoughtfully remodeled with service and attention to some nice details.  We enjoyed the ability to use their beach chairs and umbrellas at no charge as a spectacular public beach and park is just two blocks away.  We also enjoyed their late afternoon wine, cookies at night, and yogurt and granola in the am. The staff was friendly and helpful.  They have a pool, hot tub and fire pit that also provided nice little activites for a family to enjoy.  A low key but nice place to turn the pace down a little. We would highly reccomend this hotel.  The only downside was that it was expensive (for not being a large scale resort type facility and not on the beach) but

I've stayed at almost all of the hotels in town and lived in Laguna for four years.  Excluding single family home rentals or tiny spots like 14 West, this is the best hotel in Laguna. Location is probably its only drawback as its firmly in North Laguna a bit away from the action.  Everything else is perfect. Room quality, decor, amenities, staff competence, etc. Just a great job.

Summary Heading: So close to perfect. Needs demanding supervision of bathroom cleanliness
Summary: This place is even better than I expected from reviews. Pros. LOCATION. North of main beach but literally a minute to the cliff beach walk and several minutes to downtown action. Super cool branding. Every guest detail is covered. Lots of tech ports and tons of convenient storage. One of my favorite stays anywhere.  Four stars instead of five because of one issue that is easily fixed if management spot checks bathrooms every day. I am posting pictures of the toilet bolt casings that hold the toilet seat down and pictures of the bolt covers that hold the toilet to the floor. The cleaning team must not be aware that the lid for the seat bolts can be flipped up and cleaned. These have not been done for at least several weeks. And I wiped toilet paper around the floor bolts that
Manager Response: Dear luveur0pe:  Thank you for your fair and honest feedback of the hotel and your recent visit.  It is with this type of feedback that we can continue to improve to ensure that our guests are receiving a product of high standards.  I would also like to thank you for mentioning our cool branding.  Our ownership and the design team did an amazing job and it shows in every detail.    Luveur0pe, thank you again for taking the time to share your experience at our Beach House.  Please do not hesitate to contact me directly when you are ready to visit your favorite place.  Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary: We spend a few nights here in October and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Hotel is in a good location, walking distance to many nice restaurants, easy access to beaches. We also liked the free wine during happy hour, next to the open fire and the pool, a nice way to enjoy the sunset prior to going out for dinner.  Rooms are very nicely renovated, Wifi is good, just be aware that the hotel only has a very limited breakfast, you really need to go out for that.

Summary Heading: Absolutely loved staying here and will be back
Summary: Couldn't recommend this hotel enough.  My husband and I both loved it.  Location is perfection and rooms are delightful and large.  Cute touches like the enamel sink and fun foods in the mini bar.  Every single member of staff was kind and helpful.  They made lots of calls for us to confirm various things and gave various recommendations.  So many fab places to eat in Laguna and a beach you sit on all day with no complaints.  Sun rises and sun sets that are a photographers dream.  HIGHLY recommend.

This is a small property, but the location is great and the personnel make it a joy to stay.  Rooms are nice and clean - not a fancy place, but who needs it!?!?!  Liked the free wine in the afternoons as well as the warm chocolate chip cookies and milk in the evening.

Hubby and I stayed here from 11/16/15 thru 11/20/15. I will say everything about this place is on the money but it is pricey.  Staff is top caliber. The location is perfect as well. From this hotel you can walk to the beach, the restaurants and museums.  They having parking which is great because you definitely need a car to get around in Laguna.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel is ok stay there if you want but we left two personal items of clothing that had sentimental value and when we called they couldn't locate them. Either the staff didn't clean the rooms or the staff thought it was ok to walk off with our items. Either way  it is unacceptable service.
Manager Response: Dear Dilruba101:  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  I am sorry to read that you found your stay unacceptable due to your missing items.  I have sent you a private message with the hope that we can locate the clothing.  Please know that our staff is well versed in our Lost and Found policy.  We do our best to return all items left behind to the guest.  Dilruba101, I hope that we will be able to find the missing items and return them safely to you.  Regards, Rachel T

Summary: We had an unusual situation and asked for hotel management for special consideration. Management was more than accommodating! Amazing customer service and they have gained a loyal family that will return again soon!!!! Wonderful location and comfortable, tasteful rooms!!!

Summary Heading: Two night stay during week for work
Summary: I stayed here for two nights while in town for work.  What a great find!!!! The front desk staff were so warm and friendly, and were easy to talk to.  I loved the cookies and milk all day and coffees, yogurts, available in the mornings.  The décor of the hotel is so appropriate for the beach and best of all its CLEAN!  My room was VERY comfortable with plenty of room and I liked having a front door and a back door to balcony to let the sun in.  There were usb ports to charge devices and Wi-Fi was free.  Flat screen TV was nice and tons of snacks and beverages for sale. I never saw a price list, I was debating drinking the red wine but passed just in case it was too expensive.  The ONLY drawbacks to the hotel were the shower floor could use a resurfacing, the furnace was a bit
Manager Response: Dear VanessaM:  Thank you for choosing the Laguna Beach House as your work week getaway.  Laguna Beach is the  perfect  place to stay if you are commuting to Irvine or any other nearby city.  After a long day of work we are happy to pour you a glass of wine, offer you cookies and milk, or provide you information on the perfect restaurant (sit down or delivery).  I have also made a note on the drawback of the hotel and can assure you that we will address the shower floor.  I also want to thank you for the Room Tip.  While all our rooms are wonderful I think it is important to know that our coastal level is the best pick if you do not want to hear someone walking above you.  VanessaM, thank you again.  If you find yourself back in Laguna please reach out to me in regards to a corporate rate.  Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: We are regulars in Laguna Beach.  We typically stay at Pacific Edge.  JDV is our favorite hotel chain.  Tonight, we are here for a quick over night as we have business in local Irvine.  After a quick search, we found Laguna Beach House.  I cannot stop gushing about the interior design.  It is impeccable, exciting and perfect.  Every time we walk in the room, I smile.  For once, the pictures on the website are as nice as the room.  The bath products are the same as local JDV's-Lather.  It is clean, the mini bar is reasonable and adorable.  Of course, my complaint is that I can't hear the waves, but honestly this place is quaint.  I could go sit by a lit fire right now or walk downstairs and get a cookie or sit on my balcony and smell the ocean air.  Patrick at the front desk is
Manager Response: Dear DOCJAE:  Thank you for the gushing review of the Laguna Beach House!  You mentioned so many of our wonderful attributes such as: our impeccable design, attentive Guest Service Associates, our fire pit, and Lather bath products.  I only wish that we were closer to the ocean so you could have enjoyed the sounds of the crashing waves.  The great thing about our location is that we are minutes away from some of the most beautiful coves in Laguna Beach along with some amazing restaurants.  DOCJAE, we hope that you think of us again when you venture back to Laguna.  Please do not hesitate to contact me directly and I will be happy to assist you with future reservations.  Warmest Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: I booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor reviews and was not disappointed.  When we first arrived, we almost missed the hotel because there is just a little sign leading to the parking garage, but it is easy to miss the hotel!  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The people at the front desk were nice, and when we spent the day at the pool and wanted the fire pits lit and needed more towels at the pool, someone helped us immediately.  The rooms are not fancy, but they are cute and a perfect fit for the beach theme.  Mine had two beds and a tv, with a bathroom with tub/shower combo.  We did get an ocean view, but our room did not have a view of the ocean.  When looking out of the window, we saw the pathway on the 2nd floor.  I believe this just means though that you are
Manager Response: Dear Zeppgirl:  I am so pleased to hear that we did not disappoint you on your holiday! You were correct in stating that our staff was “friendly and helpful”.  We do our best to go above and beyond and encourage our guest to stop by the front desk so we can share some of our favorite Laguna Beach restaurants and beaches.    I would like to apologize that you did not have the view of the ocean like you anticipated.  We have identified our second floor rooms as a Coastal View room because a majority of the rooms have a view of the ocean from either the front or back window.  One of the positive sides of being on this level is that they provide a quieter setting for our light sleepers.  Zeppgirl, I would like to thank you again for taking the time to share your experience.  We hope to see you back again for wine, cookies, and a relaxing stay!  Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: We stayed here just to get away for a quiet weekend. This is a nice title hotel in a great area. Great for a relaxing getaway. Just mins from the beach and walking distance from restaurants and shopping. We will come again!
Manager Response: Dear J4Jacks:  Thank you for taking the time to write such a nice review on our hotel.  The Laguna Beach House is the perfect getaway for families and couples.  Our hotel is a short distance from great restaurants, shopping and some of the most beautiful beaches in California.   We look forward to seeing you in the future!  Regards,  Rachel T

Summary: Stayed 5 nights and loved the hotel. Been refurbished and is in great shape, very clean and modern with rather comfortable beds (always important).  Hotel is well located and easy walking distance to beach and restaurants. Great customer service and can't praise the staff enough. Special mention for Katie who went the extra mile to look after us and always with a smile. When we return to California we will definitely stay here again.

From the moment we walked into the Laguna Beach House we knew we had struck gold. It's a very clean, modern hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The pool is a little small but that doesn't matter because the beach is only a 5 min walk away! Great bars and restaurants are just a 15 min short walk away. We had originally booked for 2 nights but liked it so much that we added an extra night. We also booked for 2 nights later in the week on our return from San Diego o LAX. Would highly recommend

We recently stayed at the Laguna beach house for only one night unfortunately, so I will definitely have to return here! It's a very cute property with decor fitting any really nice beach house. The rooms are super clean, adorably decorated and very spacious. Some have Ocean views, many don't but you're fairly close by to the ocean anyway. There's a lovely park in front of the hotel where you can walk to see the sunset. The hotel is situated just above the town and is a very easy walk to all shopping and dining.The wine happy hour,  chocolate chip cookies in the evening and granola for breakfast are all very nice touches which made the stay very enjoyable. The pool and hot tub are really nice and clean and there is a fire pit in the courtyard which was on for several hours the

Excellent location. Almost on the beach and close to everything in town.  Fantastic customer service and "little extras."  Safe and easy parking, and comfortable beds.  Rooms and property are clean and enjoyable.  Stay here, and you won't have to drive anywhere - very relaxing.

The decorations in the place were too cute!  From the lobby to our room, everything was decorated perfectly.  It felt like we were staying in our very own beach house.  You can not beat the free wine in the afternoon, and the chocolate chip cookies in the evening.  If you are going for unobstructed views, this is not the place.  However, there are awesome view of the water and the sunset (just with a few powerlines and building in front of us).  We absolutely adored this hotel!  I do wish they did not charge for parking.... or a resort fee...  include that in the cost of the hotel...

Summary Heading: Excellent stay - Cannot wait to return
Summary: We stayed one night at Laguna Beach House in a Coastal King Balcony room and loved it. Although you're not right on the beach, the view from our room was beautiful. One night was a tease and we will definitely be returning for future visits to Laguna. The room had such an awesome coastal feel and was exactly what we were looking for during our stay. Unfortunately we missed out on the famous wine happy hour and cookies in the evening because we were exploring the town, but we are looking forward to experiencing this awesome perk during our next stay. We did however take advantage of the complimentary coffee, tea, and yogurt parfait at the front desk in the morning. The staff that we encountered there were all very friendly, and Troy specifically was who we dealt with the most -

We are currently staying here for two nights from Australia. Awesome rooms, decor & amenities. This is our last stop on our third USA trip and this is one of the best places we have stayed. Great value. Pool area very nice. Good location. Very clean. Highly recommend!

We got a great rate of $150/night and enjoyed our 2 night stay. Great location with a low key, family friendly vibe.  Staff was extremely courteous.   Nice wine afternoons, cookies and milk at night and yogurt, granola, and coffee in the am.  We also enjoyed using the included beach chairs, umbrella and boogie boards (although the surf was too rough for the boogie boards when we were there).  The beach is just two or so short blocks away.    We would definitely return.

We stayed here for only one night but wished we had stayed longer. The young gentleman on reception was extremely welcoming and helpful. Coming from Australia we enjoyed the surf styled rooms and community areas which were tastefully decorated. The location is just a stones throw from the shops and restaurants where you can walk down to the beach and amble or take the path across the tops of the cliffs. The rooms are pristine topped off with a really comfortable and relaxing bed.  Parking in the underground car park is secure and reasonably inexpensive. The pool area is perfect to relax by in the evening sun with a flame filled fire pit to sit around and enjoy the ambience of the night. We have stayed in many hotels and cities around the world and can honestly say this is

Had six rooms all on the pool level to enjoy for three days for 11 of us.  The weather was perfect, the morning coffee and granola parfait was perfect before we all took a walk along the street above the beach. Lots of room to gather and talks, have a little wine and just enjoy

I stayed here last weekend and had the best time. I scoured all of the hotels in the area before choosing this one because of the location, the price and the recent renovation. I appreciate that they care about quality and have made the hotel nice and new. The room was very clean and modern beachy style. Before arriving I spoke with Katie to confirm my reservation and make some requests. Katie was so friendly and really cared about taking care of me and seeing that my requests were made, I was very pleased. Rachel was at the front desk and was also great making sure we had everything we needed and was very pleasant. I was very pleased with everything and I will definitely be coming back!

Absolutely the best place we have stayed in a long long time. The size is just perfect.  Check in was prompt and fast with all the info we needed. Wine hour was great. A nice way to meet other travellers. As we are travelling with children, we could have used sereals for breakfast.

I can not write a more outstanding review for this hotel. It was absolutely sublime and I didn't want to leave. Cleanliness: Ace. Service: brilliant, not a fault, everyone was helpful and friendly. I was travelling with three others friends and we shared a room, there was plenty of space in the bedroom, great bathroom and shower and lots of cool goodies temptingly on sale in the room.   The breakfast offer was small but tasty, the pool was gorgeous and if you fancied the beach- all your beach wants are taken care of by a caddy waiting for you at the sister hotel. Which is literally a few steps away.   It's so easy to find in Laguna and a short walk from all the busy bars/restaurants and shops. I highly recommend this place to anyone and I cant wait to go back there.

My girlfriend and I decided to plan a weekend in Laguna Beach.  Little did she know I was planning on proposing!  When scouting out hotels, I saw that Laguna Beach House has a perfect option:  it's within walking distance of the beach, the art museum, and Heisler Park.  I decided I would propose in the park as the sun set over the ocean during our walk to dinner.  I called the hotel a few days before our arrival to ask whether they could lend a hand with the logistics of my wedding proposal, and they could not have been more helpful.  Peter from the front desk helped out by waiting in Heisler Park for us to arrive at the predetermined time, ready to take photos.  All the pictures turned out great and my now-fiancee had no idea Peter was in on it from the beginning!  They gave us
Manager Response: Dear David L:  Congratulations on your recent engagement!  The pictures of you and your fiancée made the entire desk tear up as Peter recounted the events.  David L, we are pleased that we were able to be a part of making your day memorable.  Please do not hesitate to contact me directly when you are ready to return to the Beach House.  Wishing you the very best,  Rachel

Summary Heading: One night stopover on our way to San Diego
Summary: Nice hotel located on PCH in Laguna Beach.  Nicely decorated with beach/surf theme.  We had a waterview room which was great.  Bed comfy!  Property had pool and hot tub and a nice firepit which was lit nightly.

Summary Heading: Great Spot - Stayed one night- Loved it!
Summary: We live in Montana now but are Laguna Niguel locals, stayed here one night. What a lovely hotel. Had lots to offer. Clean, cleverly decorated rooms, with everything you could need! The staff was outstanding and so friendly too bad they can't be cloned and placed in other hotels with less than stellar staff.  In reading the other reviews I never know what guests expect for the room rate. If you are a traveler who stays in your hotel & never ventures out to explore what Laguna has to offer, you could stay at the really pricey hotels on the beach pay 3 times as much.   We would stay here also in a heartbeat and would tell our friends the same.  Laguna Beach House keep on doing what you're doing...
Manager Response: Dear Patti S:  Thank you for such a wonderful review on your stay at the Beach House.  You definitely mentioned a few of our great attributes such as our “cleverly decorated rooms” and friendly staff.  As a small boutique property our staff is able to focus on providing personal and friendly service.  Our location allows you to venture to the heart of our downtown area or beautiful coves in just a few minutes.  Patti S, thank you again for your review and we will keep doing what we are great at.    Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary: Nothing pretentious, very clean, close to the prettiest little creek of Laguna. Don't expect a "beach house" literally because it's not directly on the beach. No direct ocean view from the room but as you walk to your room you will probably see the ocean from your room's porch. One inconvenient  is that you have to choose between privacy and having natural light in your room since the rooms all look to the inner courtyard. But be sure these things won't spoil the overall laid back and cool experience the hotel has to offer. The products picked for the bar are all so hip, the deco is very very nice, clean immaculate sheets, a nice touch was the morning cereal at the lobby.

Small, cozy hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. They gave me a room upgrade for my birthday.  Walking distance to most stores and restaurants. The beach is 1-1/2 blocks away.  Extremely enjoyable and I would stay there again.

Booked this hotel the same day we needed to stay.  Found a great rate on tripadvisor and ended up with the best room the place had to offer.  Had ocean view!  Parking was not included ($14).  About a 2 minute walk to the beach/cliff views!  Would recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay in Laguna Beach
Summary: This is a very nice hotel.  Our room was very spacious and nicely decorated with a beachy theme.  The hospitality is top notch.  Super friendly and helpful front desk staff.  Wine and milk and cookies are provided each day.  The pool area is small, so this is not the place to stay if that's what you are looking for and there really is no separate outside balcony area for each room.  Other wise, it's a short walk to the beach and chairs and umbrellas are provided.  About a 10 minute walk into the center of Laguna Beach where all the shopping and restaurants are, but it is not a big deal.  Definitely recommend!

Summary Heading: It was great and ....NOT so much.!
Summary: Hey, the rooms are good, the people ....great. In fact I felt guilty leaving and checking into the Ritz down the road. There is a pool...ok There is a fire pit.. Ambiance and view, lacking. There is...NO restaurant.. But a good coffee maker in room. There is good Wifi, free... But no business center, fax, copy etc. There is view of Pacific Ocean, if you find the gap to see it past the power lines. There is a lobby couch, about 10 X 12 space..  Well, what can I say. Great place if you come in late and go to sleep, drink your free coffee and get out with Uber to a breakfast place. Again. The staff is exceptionally wonderful. Very nice.  Ok if on a budget. Just bring your blinders and stay focused.

I met some friends for lunch..it was a great experience.   Overlooking the beach..I had a lovely salad.   The service was a little slow but it didn't matter because I was on vacation.  It's a great place for any occasion.

Our rooms were clean and very spacious! I loved the surfer charm inspiration throughout the hotel. It was about a ten minute walk to the downtown area of Santa Monica and Main beach. The fire pit they had was extremely relaxing. My family was especially intrigued by the free milk and cookies served in the evening. The hospitality was some of the best that we have ever received. Troy, who checked us in, was so great, very accommodating and very, very nice. Great experience and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Charming and beautiful property with genuinely nice and helpful employees
Summary: The Laguna Beach House is beautifully decorated and exceptionally charming.  The recent $1.5 million renovation transformed this property into a quaint and warm home away from home with a great pool, hot tub, and fire pit. Katie, who was the front desk attendant, was incredibly friendly, welcoming, and helpful to us as we are from out of the state.  She gave us great dining recommendations (have lunch at The Deck and eat steps away from the ocean!!).   We highly recommend Laguna Beach House and will be back soon!!!

Summary Heading: Perfect room, view, location, and staff
Summary: From the moment we arrived, we were captivated by this charming, upscale intimate hotel. The renovation is awesome, it has a very upscale, beach, surf feeling. The attention to detail is amazing from the owner’s surfboards used as a headboard decoration, along with a surfboard art display in the lobby.  Rooms were very clean, large, and excellently decorated.  We stayed on the second level with a balcony overlooking the ocean. Nice to sit out with coffee in the morning and a glass of wine in the evening.   The pool is nice, we sat by the fire pit with a glass of wine every evening, then went over to the secluded hot tub and put our feet in, all very relaxing.  Only a five minute walk to the downtown area, dining, shops, art galleries, including the Wyland gallery.  For lunch one

We stayed when renovations were almost complete, in fact we left the day of their grand opening celebration. The rooms were very nice, upscale and comfortable furnishings, nice linens. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The fireplace at the pool was perfect for a coastal evening. Location is great. I'm glad that we go the poolside room.

Summary Heading: Great Staff Did the right thing
Summary: We stayed a Laguna Beach House when it was the Laguna Cliff House. And unfortunate it was under major Construction which was a major problem. I am happy to say though the Staff did the right thing and gave us back a full refund. Many places would have just ignore us and moved on. However Racheal did not and that says a lot about the quality of the staff and commit to the guest.  I very happy to see that the construction is over and the place is making a lot of customers very happy.

Stay dates: 8/15/15-8/18/15 Room 112  Here is a recap of our not so great experience (problems described first; compliments noted thereafter):  At check in the clerk asked where we booked our reservation; she couldn’t tell and couldn’t see the price we paid.  She asked to see the contract and I handed over the print out of our reservation that indicated a booking through getaroom.com as seen here: Status	CONFIRMED Conf. #	R3886XXXXX Arrival	Saturday, Aug. 15, 2015 Departure	Tuesday, Aug. 18, 2015 Total	$872.43 USD  The clerk stated something about us using TripAdvisor (which I had) and commented a couple times what a “deal” we were getting. She then finished checking us in. What I know now that I didn’t know then is that the clerk put us in an ADA compliant room because, I

Great boutique hotel. Service was very friendly and attentive. Room was spacious and comfortable and the property in nicely appointed. My ranking of 4/5 is due to the location only.  Has view of ocean but very limited in my opinion. If that is really important to you then I would consider a different location. The "balcony" overlooks a parking lot with a glimpse of the ocean. Most of the ocean view is from front window but you can't easily enjoy it from the room. The property is in walking distance of the beach. If you have any sort of walking limitation then this may not be the best location as the beach is down a very long, steep hill. You can walk to town but again, if you have any physical limitations then it may be difficult. There is a free trolley that you can ride

Summary Heading: Excellent way to end our summer vacation
Summary: Lets just say, we enjoyed our stay so much, we stayed an extra night.  The hotel itself was in a great location with multiple beaches within walking distance not to mention the nice walkway following the coastline that you can access behind the hotel.  Yes, you could go to main beach, but why, when the beach nearest the hotel (Hessler?) is less crowed and beautiful... not to mention convenient trips to the hotel (restroom, drinks, etc.)    The room (104) had great access to the pool and a bonus back balcony with a partial ocean view (I even fell asleep out on the comfortable chairs one night).  The pool area is quite nice and while on the smaller side was very well planned for the space.  Our 7 yr old met some friends and so did we.  The staff (all of them) are very helpful and

This hotel is a really great place.  It's small, charming and well-kept.  The customer service is great.  We had reservations for two nights, but decided that we wanted to stay for an additional night.  The rate for the newly added third night was going to be quite a bit higher and a switch to a different room.  We asked the front desk if they could match the price that we had been paying for the first two nights and they did!  Nightly wine pourings and cookies.  The front desk was also very helpful with great restaurant suggestions.  We will definitely come back.

We have stayed here on average twice a year for over ten years.  It was previously the Laguna Cliffs Inn.  The hotel has been renovated which is welcome and overall well done.  What has been lost however is the former staff who were friendly, welcoming and helpful. Kathy, Jonathan and more. The new staff in particularTroy has a way of making you feel like you annoy him.  Smarcky little comments.  He didn't replenish the yogurt during breakfast, but when you ask if he could,  he says in a minute.  Coffee pots empty.  he sighs.  Where does he recommend for dinner?  A slice of pizza from Gina's?  Orange water in the lobby empty?  He's annoyed again. Kinda feel put in your place.   Several plants around the pool are dying.  Beach chairs covered with sand when given to us.  Shampoo
Manager Response: Dear VeevMC,  Thank you for sharing your honest feedback with us in regards to your recent visit.  Regretfully we did not live up to standards you and I expect, and for this I am truly sorry.   I have sent you a direct message to further discuss your visit with us.    Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary Heading: Great staff and terrific renovation, a bit pricey
Summary: We loved this hotel.  The recent renovation was a real success. It has an easy, whimsical beach vibe with a little punch of luxury. The beds are super comfortable, the rooms large and the pool was a treat.  The staff are down to earth, friendly and super helpful.  The location is great. Not too far or too close to the action.  Near the trolley and the water.  Great for a morning walk.  Nice little extras like a wine hour and cookies and milk.  I did think the hotel was a little expensive. I wouldn't quite call the room an "ocean view". You barely see the ocean.  And almost $500 a night was pushing it for us and it might keep me from returning. But it might not!!

You guys nailed it. The renovation is spectacular. The surf vibe is intoxicating. It seems every detail was attended to down to the pre-wrapped ice packs. Nice touch! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and excellently decorated. Pool, fire pit and seating areas are relaxing and nicely laid out across the property. Proximity to dining, shops and of course swimming directly below in Diver's Cove couldn't be better. You guys really nailed it. You're going to be busy. Therefore, a word of caution to mgmt: please keep up these high standards. Keep the finishes up, repaint when needed, clean and replace carpet when needed. Treat your employees with respect. You do that and we'll keep coming back. We loved every minute of our stay. Thank you!

Enjoy my stay in this central located hotel walked to beach, town and resturants.. Rooms were spotless and cozy and staff was professional and very helpful. I had the pleasure of dealing with a group of employees (Dennis,Troy, and Katie)looking forward to my next visit... Lucretia

Summary Heading: Great expierence and rooms were very clean. I enjoyed the views from my room and the staff was wonderful.
Summary: loved the convience of the short walk to the ocean and town. The hotel staff Dennis, Troy, and Katie were on top of the game the whole stay and were very attentive. I recommened this hotel to family and friends. I am looking foward to staying at the Laguna Beach House my next vist. Thanks again to your amazing staff and I enjoyed myself to the fullest.

This hotel is the best Laguna Beach has to offer.  It's a small property with an amazing staff.  Recently renovated, the rooms and overall facility is stunning.  Rooms have that beachy feel without being overdone.  Pool is just the right size with plenty of lounge chairs for sunning or shading.  And let's get back to the staff, Rachel and Troy were great, they all were.  Upon checking in, I have trouble with my TV, Rachel came right up to fix it.  When she couldn't get it to work, she called their sister hotel and they sent someone right over - The Inn at Laguna is just down the street.  He fixed it in a flash, brought me extra towels and invited me to come check The Inn.  Overall, spent 5 nights in the best place ever!  I'll be back, hopefully soon.

Summary Heading: Amazing staff, super clean, nice amenities for small hotel.
Summary: I don't have one negative thing to say about this hotel. Our experience was amazing. There were so many little details and extras they have thought of to make anyone's stay very comfortable from wine hour, to cookies, coffee+ tea & granola in the am. This hotel is a great location, right next to the trolly line and within steps from a park with amazing beach overlooks. We walked everywhere while we're there, even with our 11 mo baby girl so for anyone in decent physical shape,  all of laguna beach's attractions are within walking distance.  The pool is small and the view is tiny but I didn't care, and usually those things are super important to me. The hotel made up for these small things 10 fold. They even have a beautiful fire pit where you can sit and enjoy the sounds of the

A small hotel with no food facilities.  Room was clean and large enough.  It's not far from shops and restaurants. Lots of street parking available so no need to pay for parking at hotel.  Staff is friendly.
Manager Response: Dear Barbara M,  Thank you for staying with us at the Laguna Beach House.  While you are correct in saying the hotel is small in size (36 rooms) it is safe to say that our staff is big in customer service.  We are also conveniently located within ten walking minutes from some  of the best restaurants in Laguna Beach – or add a few additional minutes if you decide to stroll through Heisler Park.  If you are looking for a hotel that has the added comfort of In-Room dining I highly recommend our sister property The Inn at Laguna Beach.  Barbara M, thank you again for staying with us.  We hope to see you back in Laguna Beach.  Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary Heading: Pretty, clean, hip and close walk to ocean
Summary: The hotel is small. You arrive into an underground parking structure that leads into a small lobby. However small, they are usually serving water, breakfast, or milk and cookies or wine for guests. I like the clean modern decor with strong beach vibe, suggested by the three surf boards in the lobby and wonderful surfing books available for purchase.  Our room was on the 2nd floor, outside the pool area, but you can't see the pool from inside your room.  You have to walk outside, which is fine because there are tables and chairs to sit at, over looking the very small pool area.  The pool is very small, but it's nice.  Our room had a balcony that we thought our dog would like, but it is in the back and doesn't have a few and again, really small.  Our room was very cool, it looked

This is a wonderful first class property, we had an ocean view dxl with balcony and it was everything they said it would be! We walked out on the balcony and to the left was a view of the ocean...the room was bright and cheery! Nice size and lots of drawers. Nice little details like wooden hangars, makeup mirror and robes...you feel like your in a beach house! Oh and the bed was an absolute dream , so comfy!...breakfast was yogurt and granola...although we did not partake there was free wine 5-6PM followed by cookies and milk... Everyone was very friendly and they provide beach chairs, towels and umbrellas! the beach is a 2 block walk and its a lovely little cove. Walk to restaurants and shops a 10 minute stroll! Had dinner at a fantastic Italian restaurant Alessa...they don't
Manager Response: Dear SouthAmericanExpert,  It sounds like you have also become an expert of our Beach House!  Thank you for mentioning all of our positive attributes and services.  But I am most thankful that you had a happy experience with us.    SouthAmericanExpert, please contact me directly when you are ready to return to Laguna Beach.  I will be happy to assist you with your reservation needs at our hotel and back at Alessa’s!  Regards, Rachel

Summary Heading: Nice hotel...short walk to the beach
Summary: We arrived prior to the check-in time and were greeted by Troy.  He obviously enjoys his job and provided excellent service.  We were provided with beach towels, chairs and an umbrella (which we declined) and walked about 5 minutes to the beach.  The beach closest to the hotel is a little more secluded than the main beach, which is a little further away.  This is an older hotel, but the rooms were nicely decorated.  We had an upstairs room with a small balcony that overlooked business next door and had a partial view of the ocean.  The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the main shopping/eating area downtown.  For breakfast in the morning they offer tasty yogurt parfaits...which brings me to our only negative experience.  We arrived a little early for breakfast (my fault) and
Manager Response: Dear Neal 206,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with the TripAdvisor readers.  It was great to hear that you were given a warm welcome to our Beach House by Troy.  He truly enjoys his job and we truly love having him here.  I would also like to send you are sincerest apologies about the interaction from our other associate.  Please know that her reaction was not to our standards and we will continue to strive on providing the best customer experience to all of our guests.  Neal206, we look forward to seeing you at the Beach House in the future.  Please do not hesitate to contact me directly for your next visit.  Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary: Good location, recently re-decorated, very friendly and helpful staff.  This is a rather small hotel and it is quiet.  The beds and pillows are very comfortable.  The room had 2 nice bathrobes, iron and ironing board, coffee maker (Kuerig), coffee in the lobby with yogurt/granola every morning.  We had Happy Hour every night (wine).  I did not use the pool but it looked very clean and inviting.  The rooms are spacious and some have their own little balcony.  I was on the 2nd floor and did not have a little balcony.  One room that I saw even had its own little courtyard.  The rooms are nicely decorated.  Also a refrig in the room, but no microwave.  One night they called a driver to pick us up to take us to a restaurant and the driver of the town car was very reasonable and very
Manager Response: Dear Gabaldonshari,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Laguna Beach House.  You definitely touched upon several of our great amenities that we provide – the nightly wine reception and our morning offering of coffee, tea, and yogurt parfaits.  Hopefully the next time you are around you will be able to enjoy the fire pit by the pool and our evening milk and cookies.  Gabadonshari, thank you again and we hope to see you back in Laguna Beach.  Regards, Rachel

Summary: First off, this hotel is not on the beach. It's located on the west side of coast highway but several buildings back. We paid for a coastal king with balcony and I was looking forward to relaxing on the balcony with a glass of wine staring at the ocean. The hotel is shaped in a "U" so the only view we had off our north facing balcony was a little sliver between 2 buildings to our left. That being said the room was very clean and quiet and the bed was super comfortable. We were in Room 214 and I would recommend asking for an upstairs room with a south facing balcony, it might be a bit better. The location was great with a nice walk to the Pageant and the Sawdust Festival and the downtown area. All the front desk people were very kind, especially Troy.  The pool was clean and

Summary Heading: If you can afford it, book it!
Summary: We stayed here two nights for a wedding in Laguna beach and the place was amazing! The place was such a nice, peaceful have to relax at. We stayed in room 114 which had a nice little private courtyard with chairs and a small fountain for some great relaxation after the beach. Rooms were extraordinarily clean with great decor and a super comfy bed. The staff was over the top friendly and super helpful. Location was right around the corner from a nice little beach with great sand and perfect for swimming. I would highly recommend staying her if you have the means. Definitely would stay here again.

My wife and I had planned a 10th anniversary trip for ourselves this July 17th.  Unfortunately, our one year old daughter got the mother of all head colds on July 15th! Oh no!  [face-palm!]   Fortunately, the helpful staff and GM at the Laguna Beach House were more than helpful, and changed our reservation date without any problem; also, they  waived the cancellation fee!  They also booked us in the exact same room, for a date in the near future.   As a new parent, I am so grateful that they were willing to help us make our anniversary special.  I haven't been to the property, yet, but if their customer service is any indication, this is going to be a great trip!

Nice hotel.  Close to beach and Las Brisas.  Wine with plastic cups for Happy Hour and muffin and coffee for breakfast.  Only one place within short walking distance for breakfast.  Order at the counter and overpriced.

Summary Heading: Very nice, clean and updated hotel.
Summary: Sometimes smaller "boutique" hotels get a little outdated and start to fee tired and dingy. Well not this place. They went thru a total modern renovation and all the rooms, bathrooms, and hotel facilities were clean and updated. Rooms decorated in white plus crisp colors reflect a wonderful beach vibe. Service at the hotel for check-in and check-out was excellent. Parking was fine but there was a charge which is not surprising in Laguna Beach. Pool was clean and well maintained. The hotel has free beach chairs, umbrellas, and towels for you to take to the beach just a short walk away.  Tip: The entire downtown Laguna Beach is so close to this place, I walked everywhere with my wife.

Summary Heading: Very nice beach getaway in great location
Summary: We spent a weekend here based on a reading a magazine review of the remodel and rebranding this hotel underwent relatively recently.  The front office staff were friendly and helpful, and check-in was quick and easy.  The rooms are tastefully decorated in a California surf/beach theme, and everything was in good condition.  Common areas were well-maintained.  Wifi worked adequately in the guest rooms. The location is excellent, just a short one block walk from the picturesque walking path along the Oceanside cliff overlooking the beach, and about a 7-8 minute walk to the main part of town where there are lots of restaurants and shops.  Overall we were happy with the choice, and would return again, depending on the room rate being offered. I did not give the hotel a 5 star rating

I spent two nights at this hotel as part of a girls getaway trip. We had a 2 queen room and it was a great size. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. There were three of us and we fit fine. Four people would have been a bit tight. They have an cute fire pit area and pool with a hot tub. The staff was friendly. The location is bit out of the main Laguna area but you can easily walk to the beach and restaurants from the hotel. There is a great juice bar just a 5 min walk down the street. Would stay here again.

This hotel is everything we wanted and more! From the great staff (Rachel) to the beautiful pool, to the fresh cookies! The rooms are the best and so close to the beach. Fire pit at the pool is so cool! Vibe is important to us!! Care free relaxing. I'm for sure coming back!

Summary Heading: More beautiful than even the last time we stayed here in Feb., 2015.  Fresh and clean.
Summary: Got a great deal and booked 2 rooms, for our visitors and us!  The morning yogurt and granola was fabulous, and in-room coffee is a treat.  They provided chairs, towels and umbrellas for the beach.  We loved the beds!  So comfy!  Troy and Katie at the desk were wonderful, and very welcoming!  Look forward to staying here again and again!
Manager Response: Dear Rosebudreeder,  It is always wonderful to hear such a positive response from a return guest and could not agree with you more that our hotel is better than the last time you were with us.  We have recently added a morning offering to our coffee and tea service and have plenty of Sunnylife chairs and umbrellas to provide for our guests as they head to the beach.  Of course if you want to enjoy Main Beach our sister property, The Inn at Laguna Beach, offers beach valet service for our guests as well.  I would like to thank you for mentioning both Troy and Katie for being wonderful and welcoming.  We are lucky to have them as part of our team.  Rosbudreeder, thank you for choosing the Laguna Beach House as your place of retreat.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to me directly when you decide to return.   Warmest Regards, Rachel

Summary Heading: Our home away from home in Laguna Beach
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at the Laguna Beach House, was the Laguna Cliffs Inn last time we stayed.  They made some very nice updates. Our room had a very beachy feel to it which goes well with the vibe of the town. Zack was still at the front desk and was very courteous and helpful just as he was during our first visit. He even came out and lit the fire pit for us so we could enjoy it one night.   The location is perfect, 5 minute walk to the water and 10-15 minute walk into town. This will be our go-to spot anytime we stay in Laguna Beach.
Manager Response: Dear Metfanatic11,  I am pleased to hear that our Laguna Beach House is your home away from home!  We have made major changes since we were last known as the Laguna Cliffs Inn and love our new beachy feel as well.  One of the many exciting changes that we have made is the addition is the fire pit.  Relaxing by the fire is the perfect way to end your day.   Metfanatic11, thank you for the review and we hope to see you back home in the near future.  Regards, Rachel

Summary Heading: Newly renovated and right on the ocean!
Summary: We booked another hotel but ended up leaving for Laguna Beach House.  Which proved a great decision!  Laguna Beach House is wonderfully decorated, light, clean, comfortable rooms located right on the ocean.  There is off street, secure parking and a wonderful (albeit small) swimming pool.  The service is excellent with lovely continental breakfast in the morning as well as complimentary wine tasting in the evening.   Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will stay again!  Thanks for being there!

The Laguna beach House is a great little spot in Laguna, just a few short blocks from the shops and restaurants, a nice walk.  The rooms are well done and very nice.  They are extremely dog friendly and were very welcoming which is a bonus at no added fees or costs.  Pool area is quaint but very nice, sat by the fireplace and talked with other guests so relaxing. Pool rooms are a bit low so very few have an ocean view but those are the dog friendly rooms, balcony faces an ugly parking lot but not really out there much. Top level rooms see to have the best views. Nice offerings of a wine happy hour, cookies and milk and coffee tea and parfaits in the morning,
Manager Response: Dear Itlchristine,  Thank you for the kind review and mentioning what makes us a great hotel.  The Laguna Beach House is a few minutes away from the downtown area and some of the most beautiful coves in Laguna Beach.  While we are dog friendly I always like to mention that during the summer season our four legged friends are not allowed on the beaches between the hours of 9am to 6pm.  We also have our nightly wine reception, cookies and milk, complimentary wi-fi, and beach amenities for our guests to enjoy – at no additional cost!  Thank you again Itlchrisitine.  We hope to see you back at the beach house again.  Regards, Rachel

Summary: Our Room was fine, Coffee, Yogurt and Granola waiting in Lobby. Very close to a   Beautiful uncrowded Beach,Access easy with Ramps,no stairs   The staff was amazing! Troy,Dennis,EmilyKaty and Managers Rachel andAdrienne made the biggest difference.Restaurants were a bit of a walk but everyone they recommended was Fantastic! We can't wait to return!

Back in March, my son and I first came to this lovely and cozy hotel, 4 blocks from Main Beach. The chocolate chip cookies at night, choice of tea and coffee in the morning, safe parking, friendly and truly helpful staff made my young son write them a thank you note-- he wanted to, from his heart. As soon as school was over and we had a weekend, he knew where he wanted to go: Laguna Beach House. We just came from there, and it was hard to leave. They were, once again, home away from home. Highly recommend!!

We arrived here this summer the day they finished renovations. We were immediately impressed with how warm and friendly the staff were. They seemed so happy and were very helpful and accommodating. They stood out from other hotels we stayed at on this trip. This hotel looked absolutely amazing with the renovations!  Everything was so nice and clean and pretty. The views were spectacular. I still remember more details of staying here than other hotels on our trip because this place was just so much better. We enjoyed the hot tub and were able to walk to town. They also provided snacks in the lobby. This was a choice we were very happy with and we would stay here again. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Great Experience at Laguna Beach House!
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in May in the coastal king room. I had read a lot of the reviews on here about this hotel. I don't really get the bad reviews. We thought it was great! It was actually better than expected. The price was great for the location, walking distance to everything you need. The decor was really cute, super quaint!!! I loved that they had milk and cookies!   I was never bothered by cleaning staff with their trolleys outside my window (some reviews stated this), though we didn't come to Laguna Beach to stay in our room all day. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. The only somewhat bad thing was that the wifi wasn't working while we were there. But that is not their fault, and sure doesn't change the rating I would give. And they were

I hope that Marriott did not sell this property.  We stayed there 2 years ago during my son's wedding weekend.  The place was spectacular with great rooms, great views and great service.  The only reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that there are several other, even more magnificent properties in the area.  If you're looking for a great place in a great location with great accommodations at relatively reasonable (for the area) rates, this is your place.  If you want to spend double for places that will knock your socks off, you'll find them nearby at double to triple the cost.

My girlfriend and I stayed here back in September of last year.  The staff were excellant and so friendly and helpful, pointing out the best places to go.  Hotel itself was lovely, rooms were nice and spacious. It was great value for money. Pool is a bit small but the pool area is very nice and relaxing. Location wise it is conveient  with a short distance walk to the beach or nearby restaurants.  I would reccommend this place to anyone staying in Laguna. We had only planned on staying one night, we liked it so much we stayed for another night and didn't want to leave.  This place would make you want go back to Laguna.

My husband and I stayed at Laguna Beach House at the end of May. We LOVED this place!! The room was huge - we stayed in a coastal king. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! It was so cozy and the pillows were perfect. The entire room was extremely clean. It was also nice to have a mini-fridge for convenience! The decor was so adorable - a beachy/surfer vibe, but so stylish! The staff was very friendly. They serve coffee & yogurt in the lobby in the mornings and also have chocolate chip cookies and milk for afternoon snack. The pool area was clean and we loved sitting by the fire pit for the cool evenings. It is a 2 minute walk down to the beach and the most beautiful park! They provide chairs, towels and umbrellas if needed. We loved our stay and

I couldn't get over the decor of this hotel and left with some ideas for my own home. Staff VERY friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Great location across from Heisler Park and very walkable to other restaurants and shops. I only wish we stayed longer.

Summary Heading: LOTS of ALOHA found here at the Laguna Beach House Hotel!!!
Summary: Aloha all  I LOVED this hotel for many reasons.  The staff was excellent in each and every way. A special MAHALO NUI LOA to DENNIS for his assistance. The location is spectacular and was close to town, the beach and beautiful Heisler Park.  The fun, welcoming and casual ambiance of the hotel was just what I needed to feel right at home. I enjoyed the rooms with the great flavor of the So Cal beach scene.  Having my own private lanai was especially wonderful. After my stay I travelled to a family gathering.
